  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">3,761,638</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="45%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.1%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="45%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:45.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.16%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">7,427,575</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">9,742,792</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="1" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:8.5pt;">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Includes
outstanding stock options granted pursuant to NWA Corp.&#146;s 2001 Stock Incentive
Plan.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="1" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:8.5pt;">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Includes outstanding stock options
and stock appreciation rights granted pursuant to NWA Corp.&#146;s 1999 Stock
Incentive Plan and 1998 Pilots Stock Option Plan.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:18.0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="1" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:9.0pt;">See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 10&#151;Stock Based Compensation&#148; for
additional information regarding NWA Corp.&#146;s equity compensation plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">The Northwest Airlines Corporation 1999 Stock
Incentive Plan (the &#147;1999 Plan&#148;) is a stock-based incentive compensation plan
under which NWA Corp. may grant non-qualified stock options, stock appreciation
rights (&#147;SARs&#148;), restricted stock, other stock-based awards and
performance-based awards to employees of NWA Corp. and its affiliates who are
selected to receive an award under the 1999 Plan. The 1999 Plan was adopted by
the Board of Directors in 1999 and is administered by the Compensation
Committee of the Board.&#160; As amended, a
total of 9,000,000 shares of Common Stock were available for grants or awards
under the 1999 Plan. Of that amount, approximately 3,761,638 shares remain
available for distribution in connection with new awards. Shares issued
pursuant to the 1999 Plan must be shares of Common Stock held by NWA Corp. in
its treasury. The Committee has sole authority, among other things, to
designate participants to receive awards under the 1999 Plan, to determine the
type of awards to be granted to participants under the 1999 Plan, to determine
the terms and conditions of each award, and to interpret and administer the
1999 Plan.&#160; If an award granted pursuant
to the 1999 Plan entitles the participant to receive or purchase shares of
Common Stock, the number of shares covered by the award or to which the award
relates is deducted on the date of grant of the award from the total number of
shares available for grant under the 1999 Plan.&#160;
If shares covered by an award are not purchased or are forfeited, or if
an award otherwise terminates without delivery of any shares, then such shares
will again be available for future distribution under the 1999 Plan.&#160; In the event of certain changes in NWA
Corp.&#146;s structure affecting the Common Stock, the Committee may make
appropriate adjustments in the number of shares that may be awarded, the number
of shares covered by options and other awards then outstanding under the 1999
Plan and, where applicable, the exercise price of outstanding awards under the
1999 Plan. No participant may receive stock options, stock appreciation rights,
restricted stock and/or other stock-based awards under the 1999 Plan in any
fiscal year for an aggregate of more than 1,000,000 shares and no participant
may receive performance-based awards not denominated in shares totaling more
than $10 million under the 1999 Plan. The Board of Directors may amend the 1999
Plan, but it may not, without approval of NWA Corp.&#146;s stockholders, (i)
increase the maximum number of shares of Common Stock that may be issued under
the 1999 Plan or the number of shares of Common Stock that may be issued to any
one participant, (ii) extend the term of the 1999 Plan or options or SARs
granted under the 1999 Plan, (iii) grant options with an exercise price below
the fair market value of the Common Stock on the date of grant, or (iv) take
any other action that requires stockholder approval to comply with any tax or
regulatory requirement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; The Northwest Airlines Corporation 1998
Pilots Stock Option Plan (the &#147;Pilots Plan&#148;) was adopted in 1998 pursuant to
the collective bargaining agreement entered into between Northwest and
ALPA.&#160; Under the terms of the Pilots
Plan, in September of 1998, 1999, 2000 and 2001 NWA Corp. awarded four annual
non-qualified stock option grants or SARs (the &#147;Original Options&#148;) to eligible
pilots covering a total of 2,500,000 shares of NWA Corp.&#146;s Common Stock.&#160; The Original Options had an exercise price
equal to the fair market value of the Common Stock on the applicable grant
date, became exercisable on the first business day following the applicable
grant date, and have a term of ten years.&#160;
In June 2003, pursuant to an agreement between Northwest and ALPA and an
amendment to the Pilots Plan, NWA Corp. offered all participants holding
outstanding unexercised options or SARs under the Pilots Plan the opportunity
to exchange all of their outstanding options and SARs for a designated number
of replacement options or SARs (as applicable) (the &#147;Replacement
Options&#148;).&#160; For every two shares subject
to option or a SAR surrendered by a participant, one share subject to a
Replacement Option was granted to the participant.&#160; The Replacement Options were granted subject
to a new vesting schedule under which the Replacement Options became
exercisable over four years in equal annual installments of 25 percent
each.&#160; The Replacement Options had an
exercise price equal to the fair market value of the Common Stock on the grant
date and a term of ten years.&#160; As a
result of NWA Corp.&#146;s exchange offer, Original Options covering a total of
1,849,753 shares of Common Stock were surrendered to NWA Corp. and Replacement
Options covering a total of 926,080 shares of Common Stock were granted to
participants.&#160; No additional awards may
be granted under the Pilots Plan following consummation of NWA Corp.&#146;s exchange
offer.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following graph compares the cumulative total stockholder return on
NWA Corp.&#146;s Common Stock for the last five fiscal years with the cumulative
total return for the same period of the Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s 500 Stock Index
and the AMEX Airline Index.&#160; The graph
assumes the investment of $100 on December 31, 2001 and reinvestment of all
dividends.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Performance
Graph</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1) </font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>As of December 31, 2006, the AMEX Airline Index consisted of AirTran
Holdings Inc., Alaska Air Group Inc., AMR Corporation, Continental Airlines,
Inc., ExpressJet Holdings Inc., Frontier Airlines Holdings, Inc., JetBlue
Airways Corporation, Mesa Air Group Inc., SkyWest Inc., Southwest Airlines Co,
and UAL Corporation.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">)</font></i></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">$</font></i></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Item 7. Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#148; and
&#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data&#148; are integral
to understanding the selected financial data presented in the table above.</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160; Consolidated statistics include Northwest
Airlink regional carriers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.3pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-20.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160; Mainline statistics exclude Northwest
Airlink regional carriers, which is consistent with how the Company reports
statistics to the DOT.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.3pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-20.3pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160;&#160; This financial measure excludes
non-passenger service expenses.&#160; The
Company believes that providing financial measures directly related to
passenger service operations allows investors to evaluate and compare the
Company&#146;s core operating results to those of the industry.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)&#160;&#160;&#160; Passenger service operating expense excludes
the following items unrelated to passenger service operations:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.3pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 38.35pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-18.05pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a) </font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Pinnacle Airlines&#146; results were consolidated with the Company&#146;s
financial statements prior to the initial public offering of Pinnacle Airlines
Corp. on November 24, 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)&#160;&#160;&#160; Passenger service operating expense per ASM
includes the following items:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="29" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.5pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2003</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Item 7. Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#148; and
&#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data&#148; are integral
to understanding the selected financial data presented in the table above.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\Fc\75211059288_P66472CHE_1879026\5449-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 21:11 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 7.&#160;&#160;&#160; MANAGEMENT&#146;S
DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Overview</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NWA Corp. is a holding company whose principal indirect operating
subsidiary is Northwest.&#160; The
Consolidated Financial Statements include the accounts of NWA Corp. and all
consolidated subsidiaries.&#160; Substantially
all of the Company&#146;s results of operations are attributable to its principal
indirect operating subsidiary, Northwest, which accounted for approximately 98%
of the Company&#146;s 2006 consolidated operating revenues and expenses.&#160; The Company&#146;s results of operations also
include other subsidiaries of which MLT is the most significant.&#160; The following discussion pertains primarily
to Northwest and, where indicated, MLT.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reported a net loss applicable to common stockholders of
$2.8 billion for the year ended December 31, 2006, compared to a net loss
applicable to common stockholders of $2.6 billion in 2005.&#160; The basic and diluted loss per common share
was $32.48 in 2006, compared with the basic and diluted loss per common share
of $29.36 in 2005.&#160; In 2006, the Company
reported operating income of $740 million, compared with an operating loss of
$919 million in 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating revenues for the full year 2006 increased 2.3 percent versus
2005.&#160; System passenger revenue increased
3.7 percent to more than $9.2 billion on 6.7 percent fewer mainline available
seat miles (&#147;ASMs&#148;), resulting in an 11.1 percent improvement in unit
revenue.&#160; Regional carrier revenues
increased 4.8 percent on 15.5 percent fewer ASMs, resulting in a 24.0 percent
improvement in unit revenue.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating expenses decreased 10.4 percent year-over-year to $11.8
billion, resulting in a 10.8 percent decrease in mainline unit costs, excluding
fuel and unusual items.&#160; Salaries, wages
and benefits decreased 28.5 percent, primarily due to consensually agreed upon
CBAs, wage reductions imposed under Section 1113, mechanic pay and headcount
reductions, the reduced level of flying, and the freezing of the pension plans.&#160; Aircraft rentals decreased 47.3 percent
primarily due to restructured and rejected aircraft leases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Full year 2006 results included $3.2 billion of net unusual and
reorganization related losses.&#160; Operating
expenses included $23 million in severance charges related to the Company&#146;s
ratified contract agreement with AMFA.&#160;
Reorganization expenses recorded during 2006 totaled $3.2 billion.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 5 &#151; Reorganization Related Items&#148; for
further information related to the Company&#146;s reorganization items.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Full year 2005 results included $1.20 billion of net unusual and
reorganization related losses.&#160; Operating
expenses included $130 million of unusual items related to pension curtailment
charges and aircraft and aircraft related write-downs.&#160; Unusual non-operating items consisted of an
$18 million loss on the sale of the Company&#146;s Pinnacle Airlines note to
Pinnacle Airlines Corp. and a gain of $102 million from the sale of the
Prudential Financial Inc. Common Stock received in conjunction with Prudential&#146;s
demutualization.&#160; Reorganization expenses
recorded during 2005 totaled $1.08 billion.&#160;
The Company also recorded a cumulative effect of accounting change in
the amount of $69 million during 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Full year 2004 results included $165 million of net unusual charges,
principally comprised of $104 million attributable to write-downs associated
with a revised Boeing 747-200 aircraft fleet plan, write-downs of $99 million
related to certain DC9-10 and DC10-30 aircraft and a $77 million charge
resulting from an increase in frequent flyer liability, partially offset by a
$115 million gain from the sale of the Company&#146;s investment in Orbitz.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Chapter
11 Proceedings</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Background and General
Bankruptcy Matters.&#160; </font></i>On September 14,
2005, NWA Corp. and 12 of its
direct and indirect subsidiaries filed voluntary petitions for relief under
Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code with the United States
Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York.&#160; Subsequently, on September 30, 2005, NWA
Aircraft Finance, Inc., an indirect subsidiary of NWA Corp., also filed a
voluntary petition for relief under Chapter 11.&#160;
The Bankruptcy Court is jointly administering these cases under the
caption &#147;In re Northwest Airlines Corporation, et al., Case No. 05-17930 (ALG)&#148;.&#160; The consolidated financial statements shown
herein include certain subsidiaries that did not file to reorganize under
Chapter 11.&#160; The assets and liabilities
of these subsidiaries are not considered material to the consolidated financial
statements.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 1 &#151; Voluntary Reorganization
Under Chapter 11&#148; for additional information related to the Company&#146;s rights,
risks and obligations under the Chapter 11 filing.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to our Chapter 11 proceedings, the realization of assets and the
satisfaction of liabilities, without substantial adjustments and/or changes in
ownership, are subject to uncertainty, and accordingly, there is substantial
doubt about the current financial reporting entity&#146;s ability to continue as a
going concern.&#160; Upon emergence from
bankruptcy, we expect to adopt fresh start reporting in accordance with SOP
90-7 which will result in our becoming a new entity for financial</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">reporting
purposes.&#160; The adoption of fresh start
reporting will have a material impact on the consolidated financial statements
of the new financial reporting entity.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Plan of Reorganization. </font></i>&#160;On January 12, 2007, NWA Corp. and thirteen of
its direct and indirect subsidiaries, including Northwest, filed with the
Bankruptcy Court the Debtors&#146; Joint and Consolidated Plan of Reorganization
Under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code.&#160;
On January 12, 2007, the
Bankruptcy Court granted the Company an extension until February 15, 2007 to
file the related Disclosure Statement with respect to Debtors&#146; Joint and
Consolidated Plan of Reorganization under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code (&#147;Disclosure
Statement&#148;).&nbsp; Subsequently, on February 15, 2007, the Company filed its
Disclosure Statement and the First Amended Joint and Consolidated Plan of
Reorganization under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code (the &#147;Plan&#148; or &#147;Plan of
Reorganization&#148;).&#160; Copies of the Plan and
the Disclosure Statement were attached as Exhibits 99.2 and 99.3, respectively,
to our Current Report on Form 8-K dated February 16, 2007.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 2, 2007, the Company filed a motion with the Bankruptcy Court,
requesting that its exclusivity period for filing a reorganization plan be
extended to June 29, 2007.&#160; During the
exclusivity period, which is currently set to expire March 16, 2007, only the
Company can propose a reorganization plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Plan provides for the treatment of claims of creditors, the
implementation of agreements with key labor groups, lenders, and suppliers, as
well as the raising of new equity capital by NWA Corp.&#160; The Plan proposes to restructure the Company&#146;s
balance sheet through the elimination of all pre-petition unsecured debt.&nbsp;
In exchange for their allowed claims, unsecured creditors will receive Common
Stock of the reorganized NWA Corp. and the right to purchase additional Common
Stock in a rights offering. Because all unsecured creditor claims will not be
satisfied in full, the pre-petition equity holders&#146; interests in NWA Corp.&#146;s
Common and Preferred Stock will be cancelled, and those holders will not
receive a distribution.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A hearing on the adequacy of information in the Disclosure Statement is
scheduled for March 26, 2007.&#160; After
approval by the Bankruptcy Court, the Company will distribute the Plan and
Disclosure Statement to its creditors and begin a period of solicitation of
creditors for acceptance of the Plan.&#160;
The Disclosure Statement contains detailed information about the Plan,
the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s order approving the Disclosure Statement, notice of the
time for filing acceptance or rejection of the Plan and timing of the hearing
to consider confirmation of the Plan, the rights offering, financial
projections and financial estimates regarding the Debtors&#146; reorganized business
enterprise value. The information contained in the Disclosure Statement is
subject to change, whether as a result of amendments to the Plan, actions of
third parties or otherwise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nothing contained in this Form 10-K is intended to be, nor should it be
construed as, a solicitation for a vote on the Plan. The Plan will become
effective only if it receives the requisite approval and is confirmed by the
Bankruptcy Court, which the Company currently expects to occur during the
second quarter of 2007.&#160; However, there
can be no assurance that the Bankruptcy Court will confirm the Plan or that the
Plan will be implemented successfully.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Request for Equity Committee.&#160; </font></i>On or about November 22, 2006, certain equity holders of the Debtors
requested, by letter, that the United States Trustee appoint a committee of
equity security holders.&#160; By letters
dated December 26, 2006, the United States Trustee denied this request.&#160; On January 11, 2007, an ad hoc committee of
equity security holders filed a motion in the Bankruptcy Court seeking to
compel the United States Trustee to appoint an equity committee.&#160; On February 28, 2007, the equity holders
withdrew their request to appoint an equity committee.&#160; Subsequently, they have sought the
appointment of an examiner to investigate the Company&#146;s plans regarding
industry consolidation.&#160; The Debtors do
not believe this request is appropriate and will oppose it in the Bankruptcy
Court.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Goals.&#160; </font></i>The Company identified three major elements essential to transforming
its business and has substantially completed the actions necessary to achieve
its targeted business improvements.&#160; The
three major elements included:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Achieving approximately $2.4 billion in annual cost reductions,
including both labor and non-labor costs;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Resizing and optimization of the Company&#146;s fleet to better serve
Northwest&#146;s markets;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 45.0pt;text-indent:-9.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Restructuring and recapitalization of the Company&#146;s balance sheet,
including a targeted reduction in debt and lease obligations of approximately
$4.2 billion, providing debt and equity levels consistent with long-term
profitability.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company used the provisions of Chapter 11 and
other changes implemented in its business to achieve its targeted restructuring
improvements.&#160; </font>Outlined</font> below is an overview of significant
transactions related to labor and non-labor cost restructuring, fleet
optimization, and the Company&#146;s balance sheet restructuring efforts.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Labor Cost Restructuring.&#160; </font></i>The Company has ratified
CBAs or implemented contractual terms and conditions which collectively provide
for approximately $1.4 billion in annual labor cost savings.&#160; The Company has reached consensual agreement
on CBAs with ALPA, the IAM, ATSA,
TWU, and NAMA.&#160; The agreements with ALPA,
the IAM, ATSA, TWU, and NAMA were implemented on or before August 1, 2006.&#160; Two rounds of salaried and management
employee pay and</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">benefit cuts have
also been achieved and implemented.&#160;&#160; In
addition, the Company imposed contract terms on its technicians represented by
AMFA in August 2005 and, under Section 1113(c) of the Bankruptcy Code, imposed contract
terms on its flight attendants represented by the AFA-CWA on July 31,
2006.&#160; On November 6, 2006, the Company
reached a ratified agreement with AMFA to end the labor dispute with the
airline&#146;s technicians.&#160; The agreement
maintains the necessary annual labor cost savings from AMFA-represented
employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section 1113(c) of the Bankruptcy Code permits a
debtor to move to reject its CBAs if the debtor first satisfies a number of
statutorily prescribed substantive and procedural prerequisites and obtains the
Bankruptcy Court&#146;s approval of the rejection or the expiration of the
statutorily prescribed time period.&#160;
After bargaining in good faith and sharing relevant information with its
unions, a debtor must make proposals to modify its existing CBAs based on the
most complete and reliable information available at the time.&#160; The proposed modifications must be necessary
to permit the reorganization of a debtor and must provide that all the affected
parties are treated fairly and equitably.&#160;
Ultimately, rejection of the CBAs is appropriate if the unions refuse to
agree to a debtor&#146;s necessary proposal &#147;without good cause&#148; and the Bankruptcy
Court determines that the balance of the equities favors rejection.&#160;&#160; In October 2005, the Company commenced
Section 1113(c) proceedings with ALPA, the IAM and the Professional Flight
Attendants Association (&#147;PFAA&#148;) and has subsequently reached consensual
agreement with ALPA and the IAM.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With respect to the Company&#146;s flight attendants, the
Company reached a tentative agreement on a new contract with its flight
attendants represented by the PFAA on March 1, 2006 (the &#147;March TA&#148;).&#160; On June 6, 2006, the PFAA announced that the
flight attendants failed to ratify the tentative agreement.&#160; As a result of the flight attendants&#146; failure
to ratify this agreement, the Company requested a ruling from the Bankruptcy
Court&nbsp;on&nbsp;its&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1113(c) motion to reject its existing
flight attendant labor agreement and to permit the Company to impose new
contract terms.&#160; On June 29, 2006, the
Bankruptcy Court granted the Company&#146;s Section 1113</font><font size="1" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c) motion to reject its
contract with the flight attendants and authorized the Company to implement the
terms of the March TA; however, the Bankruptcy Court stayed implementation of
the order until July 17, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Following the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s June 29, 2006
ruling, the Company and the PFAA commenced negotiations to reach a new
agreement.&#160; On July 6, 2006, the Company&#146;s
flight attendants voted to change their union representation from the PFAA to
the AFA-CWA.&#160; Subsequently, the Company
and the AFA-CWA continued negotiations to reach a new agreement, and on July
17, 2006, the parties announced that they reached a new tentative agreement
(the &#147;July TA&#148;).&#160; On July 31, 2006, the
AFA-CWA announced that its members failed to approve the July TA.&#160; As a result of the flight attendants&#146; failure
to ratify the July TA, and in accordance with the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s previous
authorization, effective July 31, 2006 the Company implemented new contract
terms and conditions for its flight attendants, consistent with the terms and
conditions of the March TA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July 31, 2006, following the flight attendants&#146;
failure to ratify a second proposed CBA and the Company&#146;s subsequent imposition
of new contract terms for the flight attendants, the AFA-CWA provided the
Company with a 15-day notice of its intent to strike or engage in other work
actions, including CHAOS (Create Havoc Around Our System).&#160; In response, on August 1, 2006, the Company
filed a motion with the Bankruptcy Court seeking to obtain an injunction
against such activities.&#160; The AFA-CWA
subsequently extended the strike deadline by 10 days to August 25, 2006, in
response to terrorist threats against air travel to and within the United
States.&#160; On August 17, 2006, the Bankruptcy
Court denied the Company&#146;s request for an injunction.&#160; On August 18, 2006, the Company filed an
appeal of the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s decision with the United States District Court
for the Southern District of New York (&#147;U.S. District Court&#148;). On August 25,
2006, the U.S. District Court issued an injunction pending appeal which
temporarily prevented any work action by the AFA-CWA while the court considered
the Company&#146;s appeal.&#160; The U.S. District
Court reversed the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s decision on September 15, 2006, and
granted the Company&#146;s request for a preliminary injunction to prevent a
threatened strike or work action by the AFA-CWA.&#160; Subsequently, the AFA-CWA appealed the U.S.
District Court&#146;s ruling to the U.S. Second Circuit Court of Appeals.&#160; Arguments related to this matter were heard
on November 28, 2006 and the appeal is pending.&#160;
In addition, the Company is currently in mediated negotiations with the
AFA-CWA and representatives of the National Mediation Board (&#147;NMB&#148;).&#160; The AFA-CWA has requested that it be released
from further negotiations by the NMB; to date the NMB has not granted this
request.&#160;&#160; A strike or other form of
self-help could have a material adverse effect on the Company.&#160; In addition, if the Company does not achieve
the targeted level of savings under a flight attendant agreement, the amount of
labor savings achieved through its other ratified CBAs would be subject to
reduction.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February 12, 2007, the AFA-CWA filed a motion with
the Bankruptcy Court seeking reconsideration of the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s decision
to grant the Debtors&#146; Section 1113(c) motion to reject the Debtors&#146; CBA with
the flight attendants. The Debtors believe the motion is without merit and will
oppose the AFA-CWA&#146;s motion in the Bankruptcy Court.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has also commenced proceedings under
Section 1114 of the Bankruptcy Code, pursuant to which the Company is seeking
reductions in the costs it incurs to provide medical benefits to retirees.&#160; Negotiations with the committee formed to
represent the Company&#146;s retirees are ongoing.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-labor Cost Restructuring</font></i>.&#160; The
Company continues to pursue reductions in non-labor costs consistent with its
current target of $350 million in annual savings.&#160; The Company expects to realize such savings
through restructured agreements with our regional airline affiliates, reduction
in properties and facilities costs, reduced fuel burn, lower distribution,
insurance and interest costs and optimization of other contractual
relationships.&#160; The Company estimates it
has realized approximately $100 million of the targeted savings in 2006, with
the majority of the remaining savings expected to be realized in 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Fleet Optimization.&#160;
</font></i>The Company
right-sized and re-optimized its fleet and network by reducing system-wide
capacity by 9.2 percent during the first year in bankruptcy.&#160; For the full year 2006, the Company reduced
its system-wide consolidated available seat miles by 7.5 percent.&#160; The Company also reached new agreements and
affirmed existing&#160; arrangements on new
aircraft as part of its fleet optimization.&#160;
The Company affirmed its deliveries of Airbus A330 aircraft and now has
one of the youngest transatlantic fleets in the industry.&#160; The Company also affirmed its position as the
North American service launch airline of the new Boeing 787 with deliveries
beginning in August 2008, and ordered 72 76-seat regional jets that will be
introduced in 2007.&#160; The dual class
regional jets are optimally sized for many domestic markets and will give the
Company potential growth opportunities over time.&#160; In addition, the Company accelerated the
retirement of the DC10 and Boeing 747-200 wide-body aircraft as well as the
Avro RJ85 fleet.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Balance Sheet Restructuring</font></i>.&#160; Under its Plan, the Company
will reduce its total pre-petition debt by approximately $4.2 billion through
the elimination of unsecured debt and restructuring of aircraft and other
secured obligations.&#160; Additionally, the
Company refinanced its Bank Term Loan with the DIP/Exit financing facility,
providing a significant interest expense savings.&#160; The aircraft restructurings will result in an
estimated $400 million reduction in ownership costs including interest, rent
and depreciation expense. The elimination of the unsecured debt will drive an
additional interest expense reduction of approximately $150 million
annually.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 6 &#151; Liabilities Subject to
Compromise&#148; for additional information.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Results
of Operations&#151;2006 Compared to 2005</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Revenues.&#160; </font></i>Operating revenues increased 2.3% ($282
million), the result of higher system passenger and regional carrier revenue.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System passenger revenues increased 3.7% ($328 million).&#160; The increase in system passenger revenues was
primarily attributable to an 8.3% increase in yield and a 6.7% reduction in
capacity.&#160; The following analysis by
region is based on information reported to the DOT and excludes regional
carriers:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="59%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:59.6%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.98%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7.0</font></p>

  <td width="22" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="40" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="22" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="41" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="22" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As indicated in the above table:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Domestic passenger revenues increased primarily
due to improved yield on reduced capacity.&#160;
The year-over-year decrease in capacity was driven by capacity
reductions in the first, second and third quarters of 2006.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Pacific passenger revenues increased as a
result of higher yield on reduced capacity.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Atlantic
passenger revenues increased as a result of higher yield on reduced capacity.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regional carrier revenues increased 4.8% ($64 million) to $1.4 billion,
primarily due to improved yield on a 15.5% capacity reduction.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Cargo revenues decreased 0.1% ($1
million) to $946 million due to a 5.3% reduction in cargo ton miles, partially
offset by a 5.6% improvement in yield.&#160;
Cargo revenues consisted of freight and mail carried on passenger
aircraft and the Company&#146;s dedicated fleet of Boeing 747-200 freighter
aircraft.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Other revenues, the principal
components of which are MLT, other transportation fees, partner revenues,
charter and rental revenues, decreased 9.9% ($109 million).&#160; The year-over-year decrease was due primarily
to a reduction in KLM related revenue.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Expenses.</font></i>&#160; Operating expenses decreased
10.4% ($1.4 billion) for 2006.&#160; The
following table and notes present operating expenses for the years ended
December 31, 2006 and 2005 and describe significant year-over-year variances
(in millions):</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" bgcolor="white" style="background:white;border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">

</table>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Aircraft
fuel and taxes were driven by higher fuel prices, partially offset by a
reduction in total gallons consumed due to capacity reductions.&#160; The average fuel price per gallon increased
18.6% to $2.02, while total gallons consumed decreased 8.7%.&#160; During 2006, we recognized $39.3 million of
fuel derivative net losses as additional fuel expense, including $2.7 million
of unrealized losses related to fuel derivative contracts that will settle in
2007.&#160; During 2005, we recognized $20.9
million of fuel derivative net gains as a reduction to fuel expense.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">B.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Salaries,
wages and benefits decreased primarily due to consensually agreed upon CBAs,
wage reductions imposed under Section 1113, reduced mechanic pay and headcount,
the reduced level of flying, the freezing of the pension plans, and curtailment
charges recorded as pension expense in 2005.&#160;
Pension curtailment charges in 2006 were recorded as reorganization
expense and not included in operating expense.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">C.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
increase in aircraft maintenance materials and repairs expense was largely due
to the shift to third party maintenance vendors versus internally completed
maintenance work.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">D. </font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Selling
and marketing expense decreases were primarily due to a decline in
enplanements, a shift in the volume of bookings made by travel agents through
computer reservation systems (&#147;CRS&#148;) to nwa.com, and lower booking fee rates.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">E.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Other
rentals and landing fees decreased due to reduced facility rents and fewer
overall landings.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Depreciation and amortization expense is lower
as a result of owned aircraft, and related inventory and equipment, permanently
removed from service.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">G.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Aircraft rentals expense decreased primarily
due to restructured and rejected aircraft leases.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The decrease in regional carrier expenses was
due primarily to the reduction in regional carrier capacity which drove
decreases in payments to regional carriers and fuel requirements of $147
million and $23 million, respectively.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Other expenses (which include MLT operating
expenses, outside services, insurance, passenger food, personnel expenses,
communication expenses and supplies) decreased primarily due to volume
reductions.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other Income and Expense.&#160; </font></i>Non-operating expense increased $2.1
billion primarily due to reorganization expenses.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 5 &#151; Reorganization Related Items&#148; for
additional information related to the Company&#146;s reorganization items.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Tax Expense (Benefit).</font></i>&#160; Given recent loss experience,
the Company provides a valuation allowance against tax benefits, principally
for net operating losses in excess of its deferred tax liability.&#160; It is more likely than not that future
deferred tax assets will require a valuation allowance to be recorded to fully
reserve against the uncertainty that those assets would be realized.&#160; In 2006, the Company decreased its income tax
reserves by $37 million to reflect the current status of the Company&#146;s federal
income tax appeal for the tax years 1996-2002.&#160;
See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data,
Note 12 &#151; Income Taxes&#148; for additional discussion of the Company&#146;s tax
accounts.</p>

<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations&#151;2005 Compared to 2004</font></b></h2>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Revenues.&#160; </font></i>Operating revenues increased 8.9% ($1.0
billion), the result of higher system passenger, regional carrier, cargo and
other revenue.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">System passenger revenues increased 5.6% ($470 million).&#160; The increase in system passenger revenues was
primarily attributable to a 3.4% increase in traffic and a 2.1% increase in
yield.&#160; The following analysis by region
is based on information reported to the DOT and excludes regional carriers:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger revenues (in millions)</font></p>

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.16%;">

  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As
indicated in the above table:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Domestic passenger revenues increased
primarily due to improved traffic.&#160;
Year-over-year decrease in capacity was driven by a 9.2% capacity
reduction in the fourth quarter of 2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Pacific passenger revenues increased as a
result of stronger traffic and substantially improved yield.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Atlantic
passenger revenues increased significantly primarily due to improved traffic
and yield.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regional carrier revenues increased 23.3% ($252 million) to $1.3
billion, due primarily to the increased capacity from Bombardier CRJ aircraft
deliveries.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Cargo revenues increased 14.1% ($117
million) to $947 million due to a 2.5% increase in cargo ton miles and an 11.4%
increase in yield.&#160; Cargo revenues
consisted of freight and mail carried on passenger aircraft and the Company&#146;s
dedicated fleet of Boeing 747-200 freighter aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Other revenues, the principal
components of which are MLT, other transportation fees, partner revenues,
charter and rental revenues, increased 18.0% ($168 million).&#160; This increase was primarily due to the higher
rental revenue and other transportation related revenues.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Expenses.</font></i>&#160; Operating expenses increased
12.1% ($1.4 billion) for 2005.&#160; The
following table and notes present operating expenses for the years ended
December 31, 2005 and 2004 and describe significant year-over-year variances
(in millions):</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" bgcolor="white" style="background:white;border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="51%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Salaries, wages
  and benefits</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="51%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.3%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,492</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.3%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="51%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.2%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Total operating expenses</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13,205</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11,784</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
