</table>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Aircraft
fuel and taxes were higher due to a 44.5% increase in the average fuel cost per
gallon to $1.71, net of hedging transactions. &#160;Fuel hedge transactions reduced fuel costs by
$21 million in 2005 and $29 million in 2004.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">B.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Salaries,
wages and benefits decreased primarily due to pilot and management wage
reductions implemented in December 2004, reduced AMFA mechanic pay and headcount,
and interim wage reductions, partially offset by higher pension related expense
including an $82 million pension curtailment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">C.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
increase in aircraft maintenance materials and repairs expense was largely due
to the shift to third party maintenance vendors versus internally completed
maintenance work and higher maintenance volume compared to 2004.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">D. </font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Selling
and marketing expenses decreased, primarily due to the one-time $77 million
frequent flyer liability adjustment recorded in 2004, partially offset by
transaction costs on year-over-year higher revenue.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">E.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Other
rentals and landing fees increased due to higher rates and increased capacity.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Depreciation and amortization expense
decreased in 2005, primarily due to the level of aircraft impairments recorded
in 2004 versus 2005.&#160; In 2005 the Company
recorded $8 million in impairments associated with certain DC10-30 and DC9-30
aircraft; in 2004, the Company recorded $203 million in write-downs on certain
Boeing 747-200, DC10-30 and DC9-10 aircraft.&#160;
Additional aircraft impairments in 2005 were recorded as reorganization
items.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 5 &#151; Reorganization Related
Items.&#148;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">G.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Aircraft rentals expense decreased due to the
purchase of four aircraft off lease in 2004 and the rejection of aircraft
leases in 2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">H.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The increase in regional carrier expenses was
primarily driven by the increase in fuel costs ($181 million) and the increase
in regional carrier capacity ($185 million).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">I.</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Other expenses (which include MLT operating
expenses, outside services, insurance, passenger food, personnel expenses,
communication expenses and supplies) increased principally due to mechanic
strike contingency planning related expenses, vendor training and transition
related expense, and leased freighter flying.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other Income and Expense.&#160; </font></i>Non-operating expense increased 332%
($1.18 billion) primarily due to reorganization expenses that totaled $1.08
billion.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 5 &#151;&#160; Reorganization Related Items&#148; for additional
information related to the Company&#146;s reorganization items.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Tax Expense (Benefit).</font></i>&#160; Given recent loss experience,
the Company provides a valuation allowance against tax benefits, principally
for net operating losses in excess of its deferred tax liability. It is more
likely than not that future deferred tax assets will require a valuation
allowance to be recorded to fully reserve against the uncertainty that those
assets would be realized.&#160;&#160; See &#147;Item 8.
Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 12 - Income
Taxes&#148; for additional discussion of the Company&#146;s tax accounts.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\Fc\74121256574_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:13 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<h2 style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resource</font></b><b>s</b></h2>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006, the Company&#146;s total
liquidity, consisting of unrestricted balance sheet cash, cash equivalents and
short-term investments, was $2.06 billion.&#160;
This amount excludes $424 million of restricted short-term investments
(which may include amounts held as cash).&#160;
Liquidity increased by $0.8 billion during the year ended December 31,
2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Significant Liquidity Events</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December 2006, Northwest
issued $778.8 million of secured debt on a subordinated superpriority basis,
arranged by Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the &#147;A330 Financing&#148;).&#160; Proceeds of the debt were used to finance and
refinance 11 Airbus A330, one A319, and one A320 aircraft.&#160; The new loans will provide savings to the
Company over the existing loans and financing commitments that the new loans
replaced.&#160; The new post-petition credit
facility will continue beyond the Company&#146;s emergence from bankruptcy provided
certain conditions are satisfied.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August 2006, the Company
entered into a $1.225 billion Super Priority Debtor in Possession and Exit
Credit and Guarantee Agreement (the &#147;DIP/Exit Facility&#148;) with a number of banks
and institutions.&#160; Under this agreement,
Northwest is the borrower and NWA Corp., Northwest Airlines Holdings
Corporation and NWA Inc. are the guarantors.&#160;
Proceeds from the financing were used to pay off the previously existing
$975 million term loan with accrued interest, to pay underwriting fees and
expenses for the new financing, and to set aside $59.8 million in reserve to settle
disputed claims related to potential default interest and prepayment penalties
asserted by the administrative agent under the previous credit agreement.&#160; In October 2006, the Company and the
administrative agent under the previous credit agreement reached an agreement
as to the settlement amount to be paid by the Company.&#160; </font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">This settlement amount was approved by the Bankruptcy
Court, and paid by the Company, in November 2</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">006.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 7 &#151; Long-Term Debt and Short-Term
Borrowings&#148; for additional information.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March 2006, Northwest
repurchased $100 million of EETC notes related to six of the Company&#146;s B757-200
aircraft.&#160; The redemption of the notes
represented a 42% discount off the outstanding balance of the notes, and as a
result of the redemption, the Company now owns the six B757-200 aircraft free
of any liens.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Cash Flow Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Activities.&#160; </font></i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by operating activities for the year
ended December 31, 2006 totaled $1.2 billion, a $1.7 billion increase from the
$&#173;&#173;&#173;437 million of cash used in operating activities for the year ended
December 31, 2005.&#160; The increase in net
cash provided by operations was primarily due to a net profit, excluding
reorganization items, in 2006.&#160;
Reorganization expenses are comprised of mainly non-cash items. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Investing Activities.</font></i>&#160; Investing activities during 2006
consisted primarily of aircraft capital expenditures and other related
costs.&#160; Other related costs include
engine purchases, costs to commission aircraft before entering revenue service,
deposits on ordered aircraft, facility improvements and ground equipment
purchases.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investing activities during 2006 also included a $153 million reduction
to a cash collateral account, which decreased the Company&#146;s restricted cash,
cash equivalents and short-term investment balance and increased the Company&#146;s
unrestricted cash balance.&#160; See &#147;Item 8.
Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 2&nbsp;&#151; Summary
of Significant Accounting Policies&#148; for additional information regarding the
Company&#146;s cash collateral account.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Financing Activities.</font></i>&#160;
Financing activities during 2006 consisted primarily of proceeds from
debt issuances and payments on debt.&#160;
Proceeds from debt included: the issuance of the DIP/Exit facility for
$1.225 billion; proceeds of $779 million from the A330 Financing that
refinanced three A330-300, seven A330-200, one A319, and one A320 aircraft and
financed one A330-300 aircraft; $145 million in proceeds from financing two
A330-200 aircraft with a manufacturer; and $127 million of proceeds drawn down
under an accounts receivable term loan that previously had been paid off.&#160; Significant payments of debt included: a $100
million redemption of EETC notes on six B757-200 aircraft, representing a 42%
discount off the outstanding balance of the notes; as part of a refinancing, a
pre-payment of $127 million on a term loan secured by certain accounts
receivable; a $50 million pre-payment on a term loan secured by the Company&#146;s
investment in its regional carriers; payoff of the existing $975 million Bank
Term Loan in order to issue the DIP/Exit facility; and $1.1 billion of other
debt and capital lease payments, including the payoff of debt on the three
A330-300 and seven A330-200 aircraft in connection with the A330 Financing.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Cash
Flow Transactions and Leasing Activities.&#160;
</font></i>In addition to
the refinancing of 12 Airbus aircraft of various types and the financing of
three Airbus A330 aircraft with debt and manufacturer proceeds discussed above,
the Company also took delivery of one Airbus A330-300 and two Airbus A330-200
aircraft during 2006 which were acquired largely through non-cash transactions
with the manufacturer and are not classified as cash flow activities.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\74145425250_H10056_1873074\5449-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 14:54 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investing activities affecting cash flows and non-cash flow transactions
and leasing activities related to the initial acquisition of aircraft consisted
of the following for the year ended December 31, 2006:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="320" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:240.1pt;">
  <p style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Investing&nbsp;Activities<br>
  Affecting&nbsp;Cash&nbsp;Flows</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Non-cash&nbsp;Transactions<br>
  and&nbsp;Leasing&nbsp;Activities</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="320" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:240.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Airbus A330-200</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="320" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:240.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Airbus A330-300</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="320" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:240.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="106" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:79.2pt;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The bankruptcy filing
triggered defaults on substantially all the Company&#146;s debt and lease
obligations.&#160; For further discussion
related to the Company&#146;s long-term pre-petition debt and capital lease
obligations that are classified as liabilities subject to compromise, refer to &#147;Item
8. Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 6&nbsp;&#151;
Liabilities Subject to Compromise.&#148;&#160; Additionally,
see &#147;Item 8. Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 7 &#151;
Long-Term Debt and Short-Term Borrowings,&#148; and &#147;Note 8 - Leases,&#148; for
additional information related to the Company&#146;s debt and lease obligations that
are not classified as subject to compromise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Prior Years&#146; Cash Flow Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2005, the Company&#146;s total liquidity, consisting of
unrestricted balance sheet cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments,
was $1.26 billion.&#160; This amount excludes
$600 million of restricted short-term investments (which may include amounts
held as cash).&#160; As of December 31, 2004,
the Company had total liquidity of $2.46 billion.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Activities.&#160; </font></i>Net cash used in operating activities for the
year ended December 31, 2005 totaled $437 million, a $713 million decrease from
the $276 million of cash provided by operating activities for the year ended
December 31, 2004.&#160; This decrease was
driven primarily by an increase in net loss in 2005 versus 2004 and a $290
million increase in vendor deposits and holdbacks. </p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Investing Activities.</font></i>&#160; Investing activities during 2005
consisted primarily of the sale of short-term investments, aircraft capital
expenditures and other related costs.&#160;
Other related costs include engine purchases, costs to commission
aircraft before entering revenue service, deposits on ordered aircraft,
facility improvements and ground equipment purchases.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investing activities during 2005 also included $277 million of
additional funding to the Company&#146;s irrevocable tax trust, which increased the
Company&#146;s restricted cash, cash equivalents and short-term investment
balance.&#160; See &#147;Item 8. Consolidated
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 2&nbsp;&#151; Summary of
Significant Accounting Policies&#148; for additional information regarding the
Company&#146;s irrevocable tax trust.&#160;
Additionally, investing activities during 2005 included proceeds of $102
million from the sale of the Company&#146;s note receivable from Pinnacle Airlines
and $102 million in proceeds from the sale of the Prudential Financial Inc.
Common Stock received in conjunction with Prudential&#146;s demutualization.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Financing Activities.</font></i>&#160;
Financing activities during 2005 included financing one Airbus A330-300
aircraft with long-term debt, debt proceeds of $227 million from three secured
financing agreements, debt proceeds of $101 million from the financing of
certain of the Company&#146;s properties in Tokyo, repayment of $188 million
unsecured notes due in March 2005, plus payment of other debt and capital lease
obligations.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Cash
Flow Transactions and Leasing Activities.&#160;
</font></i>In addition to
the one Airbus A330-300 aircraft financed with debt proceeds discussed above,
the Company also took delivery of six Airbus A319, two Airbus A330-300 and 24
Bombardier CRJ aircraft during 2005.&#160; The
six Airbus A319 and two Airbus A330 aircraft were acquired largely through
non-cash transactions with the manufacturer, which are not classified as cash
flow activities.&#160; The Company entered
into long-term operating leases on 23 CRJ aircraft.&#160; One CRJ aircraft was acquired in 2005 as a
substitute for a similar CRJ aircraft that was under a lease and was subject to
an event of loss in 2004.&#160; Subsequent to
the Company&#146;s bankruptcy filing, seven out of the 24 CRJ leases signed in 2005
were rejected.&#160; The Company subleased 15
of the remaining Bombardier CRJ aircraft to Pinnacle Airlines, and the other
two were subleased to Mesaba.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

table summarizes the Company&#146;s post-petition commitments to make long-term debt
and minimum lease payments, aircraft purchases, and certain other obligations
for the years ending December 31.&#160; The
Company is evaluating all its commitments as part of its overall plan of
reorganization.&#160; See &#147;Item 8.
Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 6 &#151; Liabilities
Subject to Compromise&#148; for additional information on liabilities stayed as part
of the Company&#146;s Chapter 11 filing.</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.52%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
