<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 6&#151;Liabilities Subject to Compromise</font></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Debtors have endeavored to notify all of their known or potential
creditors whose claims are subject to the Chapter 11 case.&#160; Subject to certain exceptions under the
Bankruptcy Code, the Chapter 11 filings automatically stayed the continuation
of any judicial or administrative proceedings or other actions against the Debtors
or their property to recover on, collect or secure a claim arising prior to the
time of filing on September 14, 2005.&#160;
The deadline for creditors to file proofs of claim with the Bankruptcy
Court (the &#147;Bar Date&#148;) was August 16, 2006.&#160;
A proof of claim arising from the rejection of an executory contract
must be filed the later of the Bar Date or 30 days from the effective date of
the authorized rejection.&#160; As of December
31, 2006, the dollar amount of all claims filed against the Debtors, as
reflected on the claims register, totaled approximately $129 billion.&#160; Differences in amount between claims filed by
creditors and liabilities shown in our records continue to be investigated and
resolved in connection with our claims resolution process. The Debtors believe
that many of these claims are subject to objection as being duplicative,
overstated, based upon contingencies that have not occurred, or because they
otherwise do not state a valid claim.&#160;
The foregoing amount does not include claims that were filed without a
specified dollar amount, referred to as unliquidated claims, and claims that
were filed after the Bar Date.&#160; While
significant progress has been made to date, the Debtors are still in the
process of resolving claims in accordance with the claims resolution procedures
approved by the Court; however, completion of this process will likely occur
well after confirmation of the Debtors&#146; Plan.&#160;
The Debtors believe that the aggregate dollar amount of unsecured claims
currently appearing on the claims register far exceeds the total dollar amount
of unsecured claims that will ultimately be allowed against the Debtors in the
cases.&#160; Although the ultimate dollar
amount of such claims is not known at this time, the Debtors estimate that the
amount of unsecured claims will be in the range of $8.75 billion to $9.5
billion.&#160; This estimate is subject to
significant uncertainties relating to the resolution of various claims,
including the resolution of contingent and unliquidated claims such as
litigation.&#160; As a result, there can be no
assurance that the ultimate amount of such allowed claims will not exceed $9.5
billion.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='58',FILE='C:\Fc\74122617436_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:26 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:3.0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:13.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liabilities subject to
compromise refers to both secured and unsecured obligations that will be
accounted for under a plan of reorganization, including claims incurred prior
to the Petition Date.&#160; These liabilities
represent the estimated amount expected to be allowed on known or potential
claims to be resolved through the Chapter 11 process, and remain subject to
future adjustments arising from negotiated settlements, actions of the
Bankruptcy Court, rejection of executory contracts and unexpired leases, the
determination as to the value of any collateral securing claims, proofs of
claim, or other events.&#160; Liabilities
subject to compromise also includes certain items that may be assumed under the
Debtors&#146; Plan.&#160; At December 31, 2006 and
December 31, 2005, the Company had liabilities subject to compromise of $13.6
billion and $14.3 billion, respectively, consisting of the following:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">

  <td width="413" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:309.9pt;">

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Long-term debt subject to compromise includes pre-petition and
post-petition accrued interest and unpaid principal for financings that remain
subject to negotiations that may ultimately result in a return of collateral,
settlement or a renegotiated agreement.&#160;
It also includes estimated unsecured damage claims to be resolved
through the Company&#146;s Chapter 11 settlement process, resulting from debt
agreements that have been restructured subsequent to the petition date.&#160; Refer to &#147;Note 7 &#151; Long-Term Debt and
Short-Term Borrowings&#148; for information related to the Company&#146;s debt not
classified as subject to compromise.&#160; At
December 31, the Company&#146;s long-term debt subject to compromise was as follows:</p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pre-Petition Claims
  (e)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">307</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,556</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7,348</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On certain secured financings that are classified as subject to
compromise, the Company continues to make principal and interest payments,
either through Bankruptcy Court approval or interim payment agreements
negotiated with the related creditors.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>At December 31, 2006, direct obligations of Northwest included the $1.55
billion of equipment notes underlying the pass-through trust certificates
issued for 62 aircraft.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>At December 31, 2006, the $784 million of secured loans were secured by
36 aircraft.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Bank Term Loan had an initial principal amount of $975 million and
was comprised of three tranches.&#160; On
August 21, 2006, the Company paid off the term loan and took on additional debt
in the form of DIP/Exit financing.&#160; Refer
to &#147;Note 7 &#151; Long-Term Debt and Short-Term Borrowings.&#148;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(e)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>As a result of restructuring debt for aircraft subsequent to the filing
date, the Company has recorded an unsecured pre-petition claim of $307 million.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(f)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Assets having an aggregate book value of $4.1
billion at December 31, 2006, consisting principally of aircraft, were pledged
under various loan agreements.&#160; See &#147;Note
7 &#151; Long-Term Debt and Short-Term Borrowings&#148; for further information on debt
obligations not classified as subject to compromise.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='59',FILE='C:\Fc\74122617436_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:26 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes estimated unsecured creditor claims of $2.84 billion related to
post-petition restructured operating and capital leases.&#160; This amount also includes accrued rent for leases
still in the process of being renegotiated.&#160;
Refer to &#147;Note 8 &#151; Leases&#148; for information related to the Company&#146;s
leases not subject to compromise.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Capital lease obligations subject to compromise includes accrued
interest and unpaid principal for financings that remain subject to
negotiations that may ultimately result in a return of collateral, settlement
or a renegotiated agreement.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:13.7pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent to its Chapter 11 filing, the Company recorded post-petition
interest expense on pre-petition obligations only to the extent it believes the
interest will be paid during the bankruptcy proceeding or that it is probable
that the interest will be an allowed claim.&#160;
Had the Company recorded interest expense based on its pre-petition
contractual obligations, interest expense would have increased by $178.7
million and $59.2 million during the years ended December 31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">In addition to the $13.6 billion of liabilities subject to
compromise itemized above, the Company&#146;s $277 million of Preferred Redeemable
Stock is also subject to compromise.&#160;
This preferred security is not presented as a liability on the Company&#146;s
Consolidated Balance Sheets due to its conversion features, as required by the
provisions of SFAS No. 150, <i>Accounting for
Certain Financial Instruments with Characteristics of both Liabilities and
Equity</i>.</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 7&#151;Long-Term Debt and Short-Term Borrowings</font></b></h1>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term debt classified as not subject to compromise as of
December 31 consisted of the following (with interest rates as of December 31,
2006):</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4,112</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3,899</font></b></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,085</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The financings listed in the table above are considered &#147;not subject to
compromise&#148; either due to Bankruptcy Court-approved post-petition negotiated
agreements or due to the fact that the debt represents obligations of
Non-Debtor consolidated subsidiaries.&#160;
Assets having an aggregate book value of $4.3 billion at December 31,
2006, consisting principally of aircraft and Pacific route authorities, were
pledged under various loan agreements.&#160;
Refer to &#147;Note 6 &#151; Liabilities Subject to Compromise&#148; for information
related to long-term debt and short-term borrowings that are classified as
liabilities subject to compromise.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>At December 31, 2006, direct obligations of Northwest included the $168
million of equipment notes underlying the pass-through trust certificates
issued for 13 aircraft.&#160; Interest on the
pass-through trust certificates is payable quarterly or semi-annually.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Company took delivery of and financed four Airbus A330-200 and two
Airbus A330-300 aircraft during the twelve months ended December 31, 2006,
resulting in an increase of $444 million aircraft secured loans.&#160; At December 31, 2006, the $2.2 billion of the
secured loans issued for 57 aircraft are direct obligations of Northwest.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December 22, 2006, the Company entered an
aircraft financing facility for $778.8 million.&#160;
Proceeds of the financing were used to finance and refinance 11 A330,
one A319 and one A320 aircraft.&#160; The new
loans will provide savings to the Company over the existing loans and financing
commitments that the new loans replaced.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On August 21, 2006, the Company entered into a $1.225 billion Super
Priority Debtor in Possession and Exit Credit and Guarantee Agreement (the &#147;DIP/Exit
Facility&#148;) with a number of banks and institutions.&#160; Under this agreement, Northwest is the
borrower and NWA Corp., Northwest Airlines Holdings Corporation and NWA Inc.
are guarantors.&#160; Proceeds from the
financing were used to pay off the previously existing $975 million term loan</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">60</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='60',FILE='C:\Fc\74122617436_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:26 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">with accrued interest, to pay
underwriting fees and expenses for the new financing, and to set aside $59.8
million in reserve to settle disputed claims related to potential default
interest and prepayment penalties asserted by the administrative agent under
the previous credit agreement.&#160; In
October 2006, the Company and the administrative agent under the previous credit
agreement reached an agreement as to the settlement amount to be paid by the
Company.&#160; This settlement amount was
approved by the Bankruptcy Court and paid by the Company in November 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The DIP Facility consists of a $1.05 billion
term loan facility, and a $175 million revolving credit facility which is
required to be fully drawn during the Company&#146;s bankruptcy proceeding.&#160; The maturity of the DIP Facility is the
earlier of the Company&#146;s exit from bankruptcy or two years, and the DIP
Facility bears an interest rate of LIBOR plus 2.50%, which as of December 31,
2006 was 7.85%.&#160; The DIP Facility is
secured by a first lien on the Company&#146;s Pacific route authorities which were
last appraised in January 2006 at $3.3 to $4.1 billion.&#160; Additionally, the Company&#146;s obligations to
the lenders have super-priority status while the Company is in bankruptcy.&#160; The DIP Facility has a credit rating of BBB-
from Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s Rating Services (&#147;S&amp;P&#148;) and a Ba2 from Moody&#146;s
Investors Service, Inc. (&#147;Moody&#146;s&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subject to the Company meeting certain conditions,
including emerging from bankruptcy on or prior to August 21, 2008, the DIP
Facility can be converted to exit financing (&#147;Exit Facility&#148;).&#160; The final maturity, in such event, will be
August 21, 2013.&#160; Principal on the term
loan portion of the Exit Facility will be repaid at 1.0% per year (as is the
case under the DIP Facility) with the balance of 94% due at maturity.&#160; Loans drawn under the revolving credit
facility may be borrowed and repaid at the Company&#146;s discretion.&#160; Up to $75 million of the revolving credit
facility may be utilized by the Company as a letter of credit facility.&#160; Both loan facilities under the exit financing
will continue to bear interest at LIBOR plus 2.50%, subject to certain
potential adjustments described below.&#160;
Letter of credit fees will be charged at the same credit spread as on
the borrowings plus 12.5 basis points.&#160;
To the extent that the revolving credit facility is not utilized, the
Company is required to pay an undrawn commitment fee of 50 basis points per
annum.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
conditions to convert the DIP Facility to exit financing on emergence from
bankruptcy include, among other items, a confirmed plan of reorganization with
projections that reflect pro-forma financial covenant compliance for the term
of the facility, labor savings and pension relief, a minimum of $2.0 billion in
unrestricted cash and available committed credit facilities, a collateral
coverage ratio of at least 1.50 to 1.00, and continuation of ratings coverage
of the exit financing by S&amp;P and Moody&#146;s. At conversion, the interest rate
of LIBOR plus 2.50% remains in place for the exit financing, but is subject to
the following potential increases:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 72.0pt;text-indent:-12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>0.50% per annum for so long as either S&amp;P&#146;s rating or Moody&#146;s rating
of the facility is less than BB- or Ba3, respectively</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:24.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font>&#160;&#160; 0.50%
per annum for so long as the collateral coverage ratio is 1.75 to 1.00 or less</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Both
the DIP Facility and, upon its conversion, the Exit Facility require ongoing
compliance with the following financial covenants:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:24.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font>&#160;&#160; Unrestricted
cash of at least $750 million</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:24.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font>&#160;&#160; Collateral
coverage ratio of at least 1.50 to 1.00</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:24.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font>&#160;&#160; Fixed
charge coverage ratio as set forth below:</p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="412" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:309.0pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006 the Company was in
compliance with all required financial covenants.&#160; See &#147;Note 21 &#151; Subsequent Events (Unaudited)&#148;
for information related to the amendment of the DIP/Exit financing facility.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>

compromise for the five years subsequent to December 31, 2006 are as follows:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a) $1.215 billion represents the amount due under the Company&#146;s DIP Facility (as described
above) in 2008; if the DIP Facility is converted to exit financing the maturity
date will be extended five years with $1.162 billion due in 2013.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006 and December 31, 2005 there were no short-term
borrowings.&#160; The weighted-average
interest rate on short-term borrowings outstanding at December 31, 2004 was
3.73%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 8&#151;Leases</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases aircraft, space in airport terminals, land and buildings
at airports, ticket, sales and reservations offices, and other property and
equipment, which expire in various years through 2032.&#160; As allowed under Section 365 of the
Bankruptcy Code, the Company may assume, assume and assign, or reject certain
executory contracts and unexpired leases, including leases of real property,
aircraft and aircraft engines, subject to the approval of the Bankruptcy Court
and certain other conditions.&#160;
Consequently, the majority of the Company&#146;s non-aircraft operating
leases and materially all of the Company&#146;s capital leases are currently
classified as subject to compromise.&#160; See
&#147;Note 6 &#151; Liabilities Subject to Compromise&#148; for information related to
operating leases and capital leases that are classified as liabilities subject
to compromise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December 31, 2006, future minimum lease payments for non-cancelable
operating leases that are not subject to compromise, primarily due to
post-petition Bankruptcy Court approved agreements, with initial or remaining
terms of more than one year are as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="307" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:230.4pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter -->(In&nbsp;millions)</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="58" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:43.8pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Aircraft</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 49.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1) As of December 31, 2006,
the Company had future minimum lease payments for non-cancelable operating
leases classified as subject to compromise in the amount of $1.9 billion, net
of sublease rental income of $30 million.&#160;
Included in this amount are $252.4 million of obligations related to
facility bonds issued by airport authorities and/or municipal agencies in
Minneapolis/St. Paul, Detroit, Memphis, and Duluth for which the Company is the
guarantor.&#160; The lease terms for these
obligations end between 2011 and 2029.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rental expense for
all operating leases for the years ended December 31 consisted of the following
(in millions):</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="22" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">727</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" color="red" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">62</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='62',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December 31, 2006 Northwest leased 62 of the 371 aircraft it
operates; of these 62 leases, one was a capital lease and 61 were operating
leases.</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 9&#151;Redeemable Preferred Stock</font></b></h1>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Series C Preferred Stock:&#160; </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">As part of labor agreements
reached in 1993, NWA Corp. issued to trusts for the benefit of participating
employees 9.1 million shares of a new class of Series C cumulative, voting,
convertible, redeemable preferred stock, par value of $.01 per share (the &#147;Series
C Preferred Stock&#148;), and 17.5 million shares of Common Stock and provided the
union groups with three positions on the Board of Directors.&#160; NWA Corp. has authorized 25 million shares of
Series C Preferred Stock.&#160; The Series C
Preferred Stock ranks senior to Common Stock with respect to liquidation and
certain dividend rights.&#160; Each share of
the Series C Preferred Stock is convertible at any time into 1.364 shares of
Common Stock.&#160; As of December 31, 2006,
4.5 million shares of Series C Preferred Stock have been converted into Common
Stock and the remaining 4.6 million shares outstanding are convertible into 6.2
million shares of Common Stock.&#160; During 2006,
69,392 shares of Series C Preferred Stock were converted into 94,651 shares of
Common Stock.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:18.0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">During the 60-day period ending on August 1, 2003 (the &#145;&#145;Put Date&#146;&#146;),
holders of the Series C Preferred Stock had the right to put their shares of
the Series C Preferred Stock to NWA Corp.&#160;
Under the terms of the Series C Preferred Stock, NWA Corp. was required
to elect, prior to the commencement of such 60-day period, the form of payment
it would use for repurchasing such shares of the Series C Preferred Stock. On
May 30, 2003, NWA Corp. elected to repurchase such shares of the Series C
Preferred Stock for cash equal to the Put Price.&#160; The &#145;&#145;Put Price&#146;&#146; of the Series C Preferred
Stock is equal to a pro rata portion of the actual savings resulting from labor
cost savings agreements entered into in 1993 (approximately $226 million as of
August 1, 2003, the Put Date) plus any accrued and unpaid dividends on the
Series C Preferred Stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">On August 1, 2003, the Company announced that its Board of
Directors had determined that the Company could not legally repurchase the
outstanding Series C Preferred Stock at that time because the Board of
Directors was unable to determine that the Company had adequate legally
available surplus to repurchase the outstanding Series C Preferred Stock. As a
result, quarterly dividends began accruing August 1, 2003, at 12% per annum and
the employee unions are entitled to three additional Board of Directors
positions. Effective with the petition date, the Company discontinued accruing
additional unpaid dividends.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:18.0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
June 2003, the IBT and certain related parties commenced litigation against NWA
Corp. in New York state court.&#160; In August
2003, the IAM and a related party also commenced litigation against NWA Corp.
in New York state court.&#160; Both lawsuits
challenge the Company&#146;s decision not to purchase its Series C Preferred Stock
during 2003 and seek to compel the Company to repurchase the Series C Preferred
Stock that had been put to the Company.&#160;
On March 24, 2005, the New York state court judge ruled that the Company
had breached the arrangements related to the Series C Preferred Stock, and
indicated that a trial on damages would be necessary.&#160; On August 24, 2005, Northwest and the
plaintiffs reached an agreement, among other things, to cancel the trial and to
establish the amount of damages owed to employees represented by the plaintiffs
should the trial court&#146;s liability determination be upheld (nearly $277
million).&#160; The agreement also established
the procedural process for Northwest to appeal the trial court&#146;s liability
judgment and to seek a stay of enforcement of the judgment.&#160; The plaintiffs also agreed not to take any
action to enforce the judgment unless and until the New York State Appellate
Division denies Northwest&#146;s motion to stay enforcement of the judgment. Further
proceedings in this litigation have been stayed following the Company&#146;s Chapter
11 filing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The financial statement carrying value of the Series C Preferred Stock
that accreted over 10 years commencing August 1993 to the ultimate put price,
was $277 million at December 31, 2006, including approximately $62 million of
unpaid dividends accrued from August 1, 2003 through September 14, 2005 (the
petition date).&#160; This balance was considered
subject to compromise as of December 31, 2006.&#160;
As provided in the Company&#146;s Plan filed on February 15, 2007, no value
will be ascribed to the Company&#146;s outstanding Common Stock, or the Series C
Preferred Stock.&#160; Upon the effective date
of the Plan, the outstanding Common Stock and the Series C Preferred Stock of
the Company will be cancelled for no consideration and therefore the Company&#146;s
stockholders will no longer have any interest as stockholders in the Company by
virtue of their ownership of the Common Stock or the Series C Preferred Stock
prior to emergence from bankruptcy.&#160;
However, the Plan as filed provides that the trial court&#146;s liability
judgment in respect of the Series C litigation will be treated as an allowed
unsecured claim.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">63</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='63',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 10&#151;Stock Based Compensation</font></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006, the
Company maintains stock incentive plans for officers and key employees of the
Company (the &#147;Management Plans&#148;) and a stock option plan for pilot employees
(the &#147;Pilot Plan&#148;).&#160; The Company adopted SFAS No.&nbsp;123 (Revised
2004), <i>Share-Based Payment</i> (&#147;SFAS
No.&nbsp;123R&#148;), using the modified-prospective transition method, effective
January&nbsp;1, 2006.&#160; In addition to
requiring supplemental disclosures, SFAS No.&nbsp;123R eliminated the option to
apply the intrinsic value measurement provisions of APB No.&nbsp;25, <i>Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees</i> (&#147;APB
No. 25&#148;), to stock compensation awards issued to employees.&#160; Furthermore, SFAS No. 123R required the
Company to recognize compensation cost for the portion of outstanding awards
previously accounted for under the provisions of APB No.&nbsp;25 for which the
requisite service had not been rendered as of the adoption date for this
Statement.&#160; Because the Company
voluntarily adopted the fair value method prescribed by SFAS No.&nbsp;123, <i>Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation</i> (&#147;SFAS
No.&nbsp;123&#148;) using the prospective method, effective January&nbsp;1, 2003,
the unvested awards still accounted for under the provisions of APB
No.&nbsp;25, and therefore subject to the provisions of SFAS No.&nbsp;123R,
were minimal.&#160; SFAS No. 123R also
required the Company to estimate forfeitures of stock compensation awards as of
the grant date of the award.&#160; The Company&#146;s
previous policy was to recognize forfeitures as they occurred, and the required
adjustment to estimate forfeitures as of the grant date of the award for
outstanding awards that were not fully vested as of December 31, 2005 was
immaterial.&#160; The Company&#146;s forfeiture
estimate in 2006 was 10% for all options under the Management Plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of each option grant is estimated on the date of grant
using the Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following
assumptions:&#160; risk-free interest rate,
stock price volatility, and expected life.&#160;
The Company establishes the risk-free interest rate using the U.S.
Treasury yield curve as of the grant date.&#160;
The expected volatility assumption is set based primarily on historical
volatility.&#160; The expected life assumption
is set based on past exercise behavior of option holders.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock Option Plan for Management:&#160; </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">The fair value of options
granted under the Management Plan was estimated on the date of grant using the
Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following assumptions:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="279" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:209.05pt;">

  </td>

  </td>

  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.75pt;">

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="279" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:209.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Weighted average
  risk-free interest rate</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.75pt;">

  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">64</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

prices as of December 31, 2006, are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">(1) </font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">1.7 million of the 2.2
million shares outstanding had an exercise price of $8.31, and approximately
1.3 million of these shares were exercisable.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">There was no aggregate intrinsic value for either outstanding
or exercisable options under the Management Plans, as the exercise prices for
all grants were greater than the market price of the Company&#146;s Common Stock at
December 31, 2006.&#160; The weighted-average
fair value of options granted during 2005 was $2.63 per option.&#160; There were no options granted under the
Management Plans in 2006 or 2004.&#160; The
aggregate intrinsic value of options exercised was immaterial during 2005 and
2004.&#160; There were no options exercised in
2006.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Stock Option Plan for Pilots:&#160; </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">The Pilot Plan was established i</font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">n September
1998, in conjunction with the labor agreement reached between Northwest and the
Air Line Pilots Association, International.&#160;
In addition, in October 2004, in conjunction with the agreement with
ALPA providing for labor cost restructuring, the Company granted 3.5 million
additional stock options to pilot employees.&#160;
Since at the time this agreement was reached there were no shares that
remained available for grant under the Pilot Plan, the 3.5 million additional
options were granted under the Management Plans.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of options granted under the Pilot Plan was
estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model
with the following assumptions:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="270" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:202.65pt;">
  <p style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter --></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.75pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:18.75pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="24" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:17.95pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

exercisable under the Pilot Plans as of December 31, 2006, 2005, and 2004, are
as follows:</font></p>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">65</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='65',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of the
number of options outstanding and exercisable under the Pilot Plan categorized
by exercise price as of December 31, 2006, are as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="44%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.12%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25%" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:25.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Options&nbsp;Outstanding</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25%" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:25.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Options&nbsp;Exercisable</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="44%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.12%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.7 years</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$27.88</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">127</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.7 years</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">There was no aggregate intrinsic value for either outstanding
or exercisable options under the Pilot Plan, as the exercise prices for all
grants were greater than the market price of the Company&#146;s Common Stock at
December 31, 2006.&#160; The weighted-average
fair value of options granted during 2004 was $3.78 per option.&#160; There were no options granted under the Pilot
Plan in 2006 or 2005.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Restricted Stock:&#160; </font></i></b>Shares of Restricted Stock were awarded at no cost to certain officers
and key employees in 2005 and 2004.&#160;
These shares are subject to forfeiture until vested and the shares are
issued or released upon vesting.&#160;
Unearned compensation, representing the fair market value of the stock
on the measurement date, is amortized over the applicable vesting period.&#160; The total fair value of shares vested in 2005
and 2004 was $3.5 million and $7.4 million, respectively.&#160; All outstanding shares of Restricted Stock
were cancelled during the fourth quarter of 2005, and the remaining $8.4
million of unamortized compensation expense related to these awards was
recognized as a reorganization item.</p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Phantom Stock Awards:&#160; </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">Phantom Stock awards were granted pursuant to the
Management Plans to certain officers and other key employees.&#160; I</font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">n 2005 and 2004, a total of
0.7 million and 2.1 million Phantom Stock units, respectively, were
granted.&#160; The Phantom Stock vests over
either a three or four year period based on continued employment of the
participant during such periods, and in some cases, upon satisfaction of
certain established performance standards.&#160;
Each unit represents the right to receive a cash payment equal to the
market value of the Company&#146;s Common Stock as defined in the plan.&#160; No Phantom Stock awards were issued during
2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the twelve months ended December 31,
2006, the total compensation expense for all compensation related to
stock-based plans was $4.1 million, which includes $1.9 million of stock option
expense.&#160; In the twelve months ended
December 31, 2005 and 2004, the Company recognized stock-based compensation
expense of $18.1 million and $18.9 million respectively, which includes $13.0
million and $7.5 million of stock option expense.&#160; Cash received from the exercise of stock
options for the years ended 2005 and 2004 was approximately $0.1 million and
$2.4 million, respectively.&#160; There were
no shares exercised in 2006.&#160; There was
no corresponding tax benefit in 2006, 2005, or 2004 related to this stock-based
compensation, as the Company records a full valuation allowance against its
deferred tax assets due to the uncertainty regarding the ultimate realization
of those assets.&#160; As of December 31,
2006, the Company had approximately $0.4 million of total unrecognized
compensation expense related to nonvested awards.&#160; The Company expects to recognize this expense
over a weighted average period of approximately 0.3 years.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">66</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 12&#151; Income Taxes</font></b></p>

for the years ended December 31:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">67</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='67',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Reconciliations of the statutory rate to the Company&#146;s income
tax expense (benefit) for the years ended December 31 are as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="384" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:287.7pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter -->(In&nbsp;millions)</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.35pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="384" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:287.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Statutory rate applied to
  income (loss) before income taxes</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="36" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(1,003</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="35" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:26.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(860</font></p>

  <td width="35" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:26.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

  </td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the provisions of SFAS
No. 109, <i>Accounting for Income Taxes </i>(&#147;SFAS No. 109&#148;), the realization of
the future tax benefits of a deferred tax asset is dependent on future taxable
income against which such tax benefits can be applied.&#160; All available evidence must be considered in
the determination of whether sufficient future taxable income will exist.&#160; Such evidence includes, but is not limited
to, the company&#146;s financial performance, the market environment in which the
company operates, the utilization of past tax credits, and the length of
relevant carryback and carryforward periods.&#160;
Sufficient negative evidence, such as cumulative net losses during a
three-year period that includes the current year and the prior two years, may
require that a valuation allowance be established with respect to existing and
future deferred tax assets.&#160; As a result,
it is more likely than not that future deferred tax assets will require a
valuation allowance to be recorded to fully reserve against the uncertainty
that those assets would be realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2006, the FASB issued
FASB Interpretation No. 48, <i>Accounting for Uncertainty
in Income Taxes</i> (&#147;FIN 48&#148;), which clarifies FASB Statement No. 109, <i>Accounting for Income Taxes</i>. &#160;FIN 48 prescribes a consistent recognition
threshold and criteria for measurement of uncertain tax positions for financial
statement purposes. FIN 48 requires the financial statement recognition of an
income tax benefit when the Company determines that it is &#147;more likely than
not&#148; the tax position will be ultimately sustained. FIN 48 also requires
expanded disclosure with respect to the uncertainty in income taxes.&#160; The Company will adopt FIN 48 as of January
1, 2007, and is currently assessing the impact of FIN 48 on its consolidated
financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Significant components of the Company&#146;s deferred tax assets
and liabilities as of December 31 were as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="450" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:337.7pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter -->(In&nbsp;millions)</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">95</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
