</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has certain federal deferred tax assets available for use in
the regular tax system or the alternative minimum tax (&#147;AMT&#148;) system.&#160; The deferred tax assets available for
utilization in the regular system include: AMT credits of $134 million, net
operating loss carryforwards of $3.3 billion, general business credits of $7 million
and foreign tax credits</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">68</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='68',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of
$11 million.&#160; The deferred tax assets
available for utilization in the AMT system are: net operating loss
carryforwards of $3.5 billion and foreign tax credits of $9 million.&#160; AMT credits available for use in the regular
system have an unlimited carryforward period and all other deferred tax assets
in both systems are available for carryforward to years beyond 2006, expiring
in 2007 through 2025.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company also has the following deferred tax assets available at
December 31, 2006 for use in certain states:&#160;
net operating losses with tax benefit value of approximately $83 million
and state job credits of $7 million available for carryforward to years beyond
2006, expiring in 2008 through 2011.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s valuation allowance increased by $1.0 billion during
2006.&#160; In addition to the valuation
allowance recorded through continuing operations, a portion of this valuation
allowance was recorded to Other Comprehensive Income, primarily as a result of
a decrease in minimum pension liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s effective tax rate is impacted by income tax reserves and
changes thereto that it considers appropriate.&#160;
Significant judgment is required to evaluate and adjust the reserves in
light of changing facts and circumstances, such as the progress of a tax audit
or appeal.&#160; In 2006, the Company
decreased its income tax reserves by $37 million to reflect the current status
of the Company&#146;s federal income tax appeal for the tax years 1996-2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 28, 2005, the Bankruptcy Court entered an order that
restricts the trading of the Common Stock and debt interests in the
Company.&#160; The purpose of the order is to
ensure that the Company does not lose the benefit of its net operating loss
carryforwards (&#147;NOLs&#148;) for tax purposes.&#160;
Under federal and state income tax law, NOLs can be used to offset
future taxable income, and thus are a valuable asset of the Debtors&#146;
estate.&#160; Certain trading in the Company&#146;s
stock (or debt when the Company is in bankruptcy) could adversely affect the
Company&#146;s ability to use the NOLs.&#160; Thus,
the Company obtained an order that enables it to closely monitor certain
transfers of stock and claims and restrict those transfers that may compromise
the Company&#146;s ability to use its NOLs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 13
&#151; Commitments</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s firm orders for 33 new aircraft to be operated by
Northwest consist of scheduled deliveries for eight Airbus A330-300 aircraft in
2007, 18 Boeing 787-8 aircraft from 2008 through 2010, two Airbus A320 aircraft
in 2009 and five Airbus A319 aircraft from 2010 through 2011.&#160; As of December 31, 2006, the Company also had
firm orders, to take delivery of 36 Bombardier CRJ900 aircraft and 36 Embraer
175 aircraft from 2007 to 2008, related to its regional aircraft operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committed expenditures for aircraft and related equipment confirmed
following the commencement of the Chapter 11 case, including estimated amounts
for contractual price escalations and predelivery deposits, will be
approximately $1.4 billion in 2007, $2.0 billion in 2008, $582 million in 2009,
$771 million in 2010, and $80 million in 2011.&#160;
Consistent with prior practice, the Company intends to finance its
aircraft deliveries through a combination of internally generated funds, debt
and long-term lease financings.&#160; The
Company has firm financing commitments for all aircraft on order which have
been approved by the Bankruptcy Court.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 14
&#151; Contingencies</font></b></p>

<p style="color:red;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Legal Contingencies:</font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">&#160; The Company is involved in a variety of legal
actions relating to antitrust, contract, trade practice, environmental and
other legal matters pertaining to the Company&#146;s business.&#160; While the Company is unable to predict the
ultimate outcome of these legal actions, it is the opinion of management that
the disposition of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on the
Company&#146;s Consolidated Financial Statements taken as a whole.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">General Indemnifications:</font></i></b>&#160;&#160; The
Company is the lessee under many commercial real estate leases.&nbsp; It is
common in these transactions for us, as the lessee, to agree to indemnify the
lessor and the lessor&#146;s related parties for tort, environmental and other
liabilities that arise out of, or relate to, our use or occupancy of the leased
premises.&nbsp; This type of indemnity would typically make us responsible to
indemnified parties for liabilities arising out of the conduct of, among
others, contractors, licensees and, in many cases, invitees at or in connection
with the use or occupancy of the leased premises.&nbsp; This indemnity normally
excludes any liabilities caused by the gross negligence (or, in some cases, the
negligence) and willful misconduct of the indemnified parties.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s aircraft and other equipment lease and financing
agreements typically contain provisions requiring us, as the lessee or obligor,
to indemnify the other parties to those agreements, including certain of those
parties&#146; related persons, against virtually any liabilities that might arise
from the condition, use or operation of the aircraft or such other equipment.
&nbsp;The Company believes that its insurance would cover most of the exposure
to such liabilities and related indemnities associated with the types of lease
and financing agreements described above, including real estate leases.&nbsp;
However, the Company&#146;s insurance does not typically cover environmental
liabilities.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">69</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='69',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain of our aircraft and other financing transactions include
provisions which require us to make payments to preserve an expected economic
return to the lenders if that economic return is diminished due to certain
changes in law or regulations. &nbsp;In certain of these financing
transactions, the Company also bears the risk of certain changes in tax laws
that would subject payments to non-U.S. lenders to withholding taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company obtains letters of credit (&#147;LOCs&#148;) from commercial banks in
favor of various parties to secure obligations of the Company to such parties.
As of December 31, 2006, the total outstanding amount of these LOCs was $90.6
million (excluding an additional $126.7 million of LOCs that were fully secured
by the Company&#146;s pledge of cash collateral). The obligations of the Company
with respect to this $90.6 million of LOCs, together with certain other
obligations of the Company, are secured by the Company&#146;s routes, certain
aircraft and cash collateral.</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 15 &#151; Pension and Other Postretirement Health Care Benefits</font></b></h1>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has several defined benefit pension plans or defined contribution 401(k)-type plans
covering substantially all of its employees.&#160;
Northwest froze future benefit accruals for its defined benefit Pension
Plans for Salaried Employees, Pilot Employees, and Contract Employees effective
August 31, 2005, January 31, 2006, and September 30, 2006, respectively.&#160; Replacement coverage will be provided for
these employees through 401(k)-type defined contribution plans or in the case
of IAM represented employees, the IAM National Multi-Employer Plan.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest also sponsors various contributory and
noncontributory medical, dental and life insurance benefit plans covering
certain eligible retirees and their dependents.&#160;
The expected future cost of providing such postretirement benefits is
accrued over the service lives of active employees.&#160; Retired employees are not offered
Company-paid medical and dental benefits after age 64, with the exception of
certain employees who retired prior to 1987 and receive lifetime Company-paid
medical and dental benefits.&#160; Prior to
age 65, the retiree share of the cost of medical and dental coverage is based
on a combination of years of service and age at retirement.&#160; Medical and dental benefit plans are unfunded
and costs are paid as incurred.&#160; The
pilot group is provided Company-paid decreasing term life insurance coverage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Pension Protection Act of 2006 (&#147;2006 Pension Act&#148;) was signed into
law on August 17, 2006. The 2006 Pension Act allows commercial airlines to
elect special funding rules for defined benefit plans that are frozen.&#160; The unfunded liability for a frozen defined
benefit plan may be amortized over a fixed 17-year period. The unfunded
liability is defined as the actuarial liability calculated using an 8.85%
interest rate minus the fair market value of plan assets.&#160; Northwest elected the special funding rules
for frozen defined benefit plans under the 2006 Pension Act effective October
1, 2006.&#160; As a result of this election
(1) the funding waivers that Northwest received for the 2003 plan year
contributions were deemed satisfied under the 2006 Pension Act, and (2) the
funding standard account for each Plan had no deficiency as of September 30,
2006.&#160; However, new contributions that
come due under the 2006 Pension Act funding rules must be paid even while
Northwest is in bankruptcy.&#160; If the new
contributions are not paid, the future funding deficiency that would develop
will be based on the regular funding rules rather than the special funding
rules.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It is Northwest&#146;s policy to
fund annually at least the minimum contribution as required by the Employee
Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended (&#147;ERISA&#148;).&#160; However, as a result of the commencement of
Northwest&#146;s Chapter 11 case, Northwest did not make minimum cash contributions
to its defined benefit pension plans that were due after September 14,
2005.&#160; Subsequent to Northwest&#146;s
bankruptcy filing and prior to its election under the 2006 Pension Act,
Northwest paid the normal cost component of the plans&#146; minimum funding
requirements relating to service rendered post-petition and certain interest
payments associated with its 2003 Contract Plan and Salaried Plan year
waivers.&#160; As noted above, effective
October 1, 2006, Northwest elected the special funding rules available to
commercial airlines.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:18.0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">As a result
of Northwest&#146;s Chapter 11 filing, we appointed an independent fiduciary for all
of our tax-qualified defined benefit pension plans to pursue, on behalf of the
plans, claims to recover minimum funding contributions due under federal law,
to the extent that Northwest did not continue to fund the plans due to
bankruptcy prohibitions. We have been advised that the independent fiduciary
intends to withdraw all of the claims that the independent fiduciary has filed
in our Chapter 11 Case following the enactment of the 2006 Pension Protection
Act.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest&#146;s 2006 calendar year contributions to
qualified defined benefit plans and the replacement plans were approximately
$112 million.&#160; In 2007, Northwest&#146;s
calendar year contributions to its frozen defined benefit plans under the
provisions of the 2006 Pension Act and the replacement plans will approximate
$120 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;)
issued SFAS No. 158, which amends SFAS No. 87, <i>Employers&#146;
Accounting for Pensions</i> (&#147;SFAS No. 87&#148;) and SFAS No. 106,<i> Employers&#146; Accounting for Postretirement Benefits
Other Than Pensions </i>(&#147;SFAS No. 106&#148;) to require recognition of the
overfunded or underfunded status of pension and other postretirement benefit
plans on the balance sheet. Under SFAS No. 158, gains and losses, prior service
costs and credits, and any remaining transition amounts under SFAS No. 87 and
SFAS No. 106 that have not yet been recognized through net periodic
&nbsp;benefit cost will be recognized in accumulated other comprehensive
income, net of tax effects. The measurement date &#151; the date at which the
benefit obligation and plan assets are measured &#151; is required to be the company&#146;s
fiscal year end. The Company previously utilized a fiscal year-end measurement
date.&#160; SFAS No. 158 is effective for
publicly-held companies for fiscal years ending after December 15, 2006, except
for the</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">70</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='70',FILE='C:\Fc\7520279191_P66473CHE_1878810\5449-1-fo.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 16 20:27 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">measurement
date provisions, which are effective for fiscal years ending after December 15,
2008. The adoption of SFAS No. 158 increased the Company&#146;s long-term pension
and other postretirement benefit liabilities.&#160;
SFAS No. 158 does not affect the results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">The following is a
reconciliation of the beginning and ending balances of the benefit obligations,
the fair value of plan assets, and the funded status:</font></i></b></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

  <td width="378" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:283.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest cost</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.35pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="36" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1,046</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The Company transferred the liability
associated with certain long-term disability benefits previously provided in
the Northwest Airlines Pension Plan for Pilots to a self-funded long-term
disability plan that provides substantially similar benefits.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accumulated benefit obligations for all defined benefit pension
plans were $9.36 billion and $9.45 billion at December 31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; The Company&#146;s pension
plans with accumulated benefit obligations in excess of plan assets as of
December 31 were as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="35" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:26.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">n/a</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="35" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:26.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="326" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:244.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">Current liability</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(28</font></b></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">n/a</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="42" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:31.55pt;">

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1,620</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">2,323</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="42" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:31.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">286</font></b></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="28" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="290" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:217.35pt;">

  actuarial loss and other events</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">72</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='72',FILE='C:\Fc\74121428529_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">Related to the freezing of Northwest&#146;s defined benefit plans
covering domestic employees in 2005 and 2006, Northwest recorded pension
curtailment charges and gains.&#160;
Curtailment charges recorded prior to Northwest&#146;s bankruptcy filing were
recorded in pension expense; curtailment charges and gains recorded after
Northwest&#146;s Chapter 11 filing have been recorded as a component of net reorganization
expense.&#160; Northwest has recorded the
following pension curtailment amounts:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="367" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.1pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableCenter -->(In&nbsp;millions)</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="29" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.5pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

amortized from accumulated other comprehensive income into net periodic benefit
cost in 2007:</font></i></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

assumptions used to determine net periodic pension and other benefit costs for

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">(1) Not applicable to frozen plans.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has adopted and implemented an investment policy
for the defined benefit pension plans that incorporates a strategic asset
allocation mix designed to best meet the Company&#146;s long-term pension
obligations.&#160; This asset allocation
policy mix is reviewed every 2-3 years and, on a regular basis, actual
allocations are rebalanced toward the prevailing targets.&#160; The following table summarizes actual
allocations as of December 31, 2006 and 2005:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">%</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">47.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The investment policy also emphasizes the
following key objectives: (1) maintain a diversified portfolio among asset
classes and investment styles; (2) maintain an acceptable level of risk in
pursuit of long-term economic benefit; (3) maximize the opportunity for
value-added returns from active management; (4) capture return opportunities
from inefficiencies in nontraditional capital markets; and (5) maintain
adequate controls over administrative costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">To meet these objectives, the Company&#146;s
investment policy reflects the following major themes: (1) diversify holdings
to achieve broad coverage of both stock and bond markets; (2) utilize market
index funds as a core strategy, where appropriate, to ensure broad
diversification, minimal fees, and reduced risk of relative underperformance of
the portfolio; (3) use active investment managers with disciplined, clearly
defined strategies, while establishing investment guidelines and </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">73</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='73',FILE='C:\Fc\74121428529_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">monitoring procedures for each investment manager to ensure the
characteristics of the portfolio are consistent with the original investment
mandate; and (4) maintain an allocation to nontraditional investments, where
market inefficiencies are greatest, and use these investments primarily to
enhance the overall returns.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reviews its rate of return on
plan asset assumptions annually. These assumptions are largely based on the
asset category rate-of-return assumptions developed annually with the Company&#146;s
pension investment advisors. The advisors&#146; asset category return assumptions
are based in part on a review of historical asset returns, but also emphasize
current market conditions to develop estimates of future risk and return.
Current market conditions include the yield-to-maturity and credit spreads on a
broad bond market benchmark in the case of fixed income asset classes, and
current prices as well as earnings and dividend growth rates in the case of
equity asset classes. The assumptions are also adjusted to account for the
value of active management the funds have provided historically. The Company&#146;s
expected long-term rate of return is based on target asset allocations of 45%
domestic equities with an expected rate of return of 8.75%; 25% international
equities with an expected rate of return of 8.75%; 10% private markets with an
expected rate of return of 12.25%; 15% long-duration bonds with an expected
rate of return of 6.0%; and 5% high yield bonds with an expected rate of return
of 7.25%.&#160; These assumptions result in a
weighted geometric average rate of return of 9.0% on an annual basis.&#160; The Company historically weighted these
assumptions based on an arithmetic average.&#160;
Beginning in 2006, the Company weighted the above category
rate-of-return assumptions based on a geometric average.&#160; The Company believes this change from
arithmetic to geometric is preferable to its prior method in that it
incorporates the underlying volatility of various asset category rate-of-return
trends.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">For measurement purposes, an 8.5% annual rate of increase in the
per capita cost of covered health care benefits was assumed for 2007.&#160; The rate was assumed to decrease 0.5% per
year for seven years to 5.0% in 2014 and remain at that level thereafter.&#160; Assumed health care cost trend rates have a significant
impact on the amounts reported under other benefits, above, for the health care
plans.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">A one percent-change in
assumed health care cost trend rates would have the following effects:</font></i></b></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="374" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:280.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effect on total of
  service and interest cost components</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="71" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:53.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.4</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="71" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:53.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(8.8</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="374" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:280.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effect on accumulated postretirement benefit obligations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="78" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:58.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">73.7</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="78" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:58.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(65.0</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="374" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="71" style="border:none;"></td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">The
estimated future benefit payments expected to be made by the pension and other
postretirement benefit plans are shown below:</font></i></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3,082</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="72" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">343</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="280" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="66" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 16 &#151; Risk Management and Financial Instruments</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company adopted SFAS No. 133, <i>Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities</i> (&#147;SFAS No. 133&#148;), which requires the
Company to recognize all derivatives on the balance sheet at fair value.&#160; The Company uses derivatives as cash flow
hedges to manage the price risk of fuel and its exposure to foreign currency
fluctuations.&#160; SFAS No. 133 requires that
for cash flow hedges, which hedge the exposure to variable cash flows of a
forecasted transaction, the effective portion of the derivative&#146;s gain or loss
be initially reported as a component of other comprehensive income (loss) in
the equity section of the balance sheet and subsequently reclassified into
earnings when the forecasted transaction affects earnings.&#160; Any ineffective portion of the derivative&#146;s
gain or loss is reported in earnings immediately.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Risk Management: </font></i></b><i><font color="black" style="color:black;font-style:italic;">&#160;</font></i><font color="black" style="color:black;">The Company principally uses
derivative financial instruments to manage specific risks and does not hold or
issue them for trading purposes.&#160; The
notional amounts of financial instruments summarized below did not</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">74</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='74',FILE='C:\Fc\74121428529_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">represent amounts exchanged between parties and, therefore, are
not a measure of the Company&#146;s exposure resulting from its use of derivatives.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Foreign Currency: </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:black;">&#160;The Company is exposed to the effect of
foreign exchange rate fluctuations on the U.S. dollar value of foreign
currency-denominated operating revenues and expenses.&#160; The Company&#146;s largest exposure comes from the
Japanese yen.&#160; In 2006, the Company&#146;s yen-denominated
net cash inflow was approximately 86 billion yen ($747 million).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company uses forward contracts,
collars or put options to hedge a portion of its anticipated yen-denominated
sales.&#160; The changes in market value of
such instruments have historically been highly effective at offsetting exchange
rate fluctuations in yen-denominated sales.&#160;
At December 31, 2006, the Company had no forward contracts in place for
2007 and therefore had no balance associated with yen hedge contracts
outstanding in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss).&#160; Hedging gains or losses are recorded in
revenue when transportation is provided.&#160;
The Japanese yen financial instruments utilized to hedge yen-denominated
cash flows resulted in realized gains of $9 million and $11 million in 2006 and
2005, respectively, and a realized loss of $8 million in 2004.</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">Counterparties to these financial instruments expose the Company
to credit loss in the event of nonperformance, but the Company does not expect
any of the counterparties to fail to meet their obligations.&#160; The amount of such credit exposure is
generally the unrealized gains, if any, in such contracts.&#160; To manage credit risks, the Company selects
counterparties based on credit ratings, limits exposure to any single counterparty
and monitors the market position with each counterparty.&#160; It is the Company&#146;s practice to participate
in foreign currency hedging transactions with a maximum span of 24 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Aircraft Fuel: </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:black;">&#160;The Company is exposed to the effect of
changes in the price and availability of aircraft fuel.&#160; In order to provide a measure of control over
price and supply, the Company trades and ships fuel and maintains fuel storage
facilities to support its flight operations.&#160;
To further manage the price risk of fuel costs, the Company primarily
utilizes futures contracts traded on regulated futures exchanges, swap
agreements and options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006, the Company had economically
hedged the price of approximately 35% of its projected fuel requirements for
2007, through a combination of collar options and fixed price swap
agreements.&#160; Including an additional
fixed price swap agreement entered into during January 2007, the Company has
hedged the price of approximately 40% of its projected fuel requirements for
2007.&#160;&#160; All of the Company&#146;s existing
fuel derivative contracts will expire on or before December 31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The collar options, which hedge the price of
approximately 30% of the Company&#146;s projected fuel requirements for 2007,
consist of crude oil put options with a price range of $53 to $56.70 per
barrel, and related call options at a price of $72 per barrel.&#160; The fixed price crude oil swap agreements,
which hedge the price of approximately 10% of the Company&#146;s projected fuel
requirements for 2007, include agreements with a price range of $62 to $64.98
per barrel.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company currently has no fuel derivative contracts
outstanding that are designated for hedge accounting treatment, and therefore
had no related unrealized gains (losses) in accumulated other comprehensive
income (loss) as of December 31, 2006. The Company records any changes in the
contracts&#146; values as mark-to-market adjustments through the statement of
operations on a monthly basis.&#160; During
2006, the Company recognized $39.3 million of fuel derivative net losses as
additional fuel expense, including $2.7 million of unrealized losses related to
fuel derivative contracts that will settle in 2007.&#160; During 2005 and 2004, the Company recognized
$20.9 million and $28.7 million of fuel derivative net gains as a reduction to
fuel expense, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest Rates:</font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:black;">&#160; The Company&#146;s earnings are also affected by
changes in interest rates due to the impact those changes have on its interest
income from cash equivalents and short-term investments and its interest
expense from floating rate debt instruments.&#160;
During June 2006, the Company entered into individual interest rate cap
hedges related to three floating rate debt instruments, with a total cumulative
notional amount of $504 million.&#160; The
objective of the interest rate cap hedges is to protect the anticipated
payments of interest (cash flows) on the designated debt instruments from
adverse market interest rate changes.&#160;
The maturity date of each of the interest rate cap hedges corresponds
exactly with the maturity dates of the three designated debt instruments.&#160; As of December 31, 2006, the Company has
recorded $3.5 million of unrealized losses in accumulated other comprehensive
income (loss) associated with these hedges.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">75</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='75',FILE='C:\Fc\74121428529_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:14 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Fair Values of Financial Instruments:
</font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:black;">The financial statement carrying values equal the fair values of
the Company&#146;s cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments.&#160; As of December 31, these amounts were:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">Cash equivalents are carried at cost and
consisted primarily of unrestricted money market funds as of December 31,
2006.&#160; These instruments approximate fair
value due to their short maturity.&#160; The
Company classifies investments with a remaining maturity of more than three
months on their acquisition date and those temporarily restricted as short-term
investments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The financial statement carrying values
and estimated fair values of the Company&#146;s financial instruments, including
current maturities, as of December 31 were:</font></p>

  <td width="43" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.3pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Value</font></b></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:red;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The fair values of the Company&#146;s long-term debt classified as not
subject to compromise were estimated using discounted cash flow analyses.&#160; The discount rates were based on internal
estimates of market rates supported by restructuring efforts on similar types
of instruments.</font></p>

<h1 style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 17 &#151; </font></b><b><font color="black" style="color:black;font-weight:bold;">Investment Securities</font></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The amortized cost, gross unrealized
gains and losses, and fair value of short-term investment securities classified
as available-for-sale as of December 31 were as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.18%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:black;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:black;">Available-for-sale securities are
carried at fair value, with unrealized net gains or losses reported within
other comprehensive income in stockholders&#146; equity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2006, the fair value
of available-for-sale securities includes investments totaling $56 million,
with unrealized losses of $2.3 million, which have been in an unrealized loss
position for greater than 12 months.&#160; The
investments consist of 62 securities that are primarily high credit quality
fixed income securities.&#160;&#160; All other
available-for-sale securities, with unrealized losses of $2.3 million, which
have been in an unrealized loss position for less than 12 months, have an
aggregate fair value of $204 million.&#160;
These securities primarily represent fixed income investments with
temporary impairments resulting from increases in interest rates since the
purchase of the investments.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">76</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='76',FILE='C:\Fc\74121428529_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:14 2007' -->

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

as to the amount of gross gains and losses realized through the sale of
available-for-sale investment securities for the years ending December 31:</font></p>

  <td width="22" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(1</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(27</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(10</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="337" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:253.05pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(1</font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">(1) &#160; Realized
gains and losses are identified using the specific identification method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The contractual maturities of debt
securities available-for-sale at December 31, 2006 are shown below.&#160; Expected maturities may differ from
contractual maturities because borrowers may have the right to recall or prepay
obligations with or without call or prepayment penalties.</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 18 &#151; Related
Party Transactions</font></b></h1>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Pinnacle: </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:black;">The Company
continues to own 11.4% of the Common Stock of Pinnacle Airlines Corp., and
accounts for this investment under the equity method of accounting.&#160; The Pinnacle Airlines Corp. Common Stock had
a market value of $42.0 million and a book value of $11.8 million as of
December 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest and Pinnacle Airlines have entered into an airline
services agreement, under which Northwest determines Pinnacle Airlines&#146;
commuter aircraft scheduling and fleet composition.&#160; The agreement is structured as a capacity
purchase agreement whereby Northwest pays Pinnacle Airlines to operate the
flights on Northwest&#146;s behalf and Northwest is entitled to all revenues
associated with those flights.&#160; Under
this agreement, Northwest paid $596 million, $572 million and $493 million for
the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160; The Company had payables of $131 million and
$81 million to Pinnacle Airlines as of December 31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; As of December 31, 2006,
the Company has leased 124 CRJ aircraft, which are in turn subleased to
Pinnacle Airlines.&#160; As part of its
overall restructuring efforts, the Company evaluated its airline services
agreements with its regional carriers, initiated a request for proposal from
its existing and other regional carrier operators, and obtained Bankruptcy
Court approval of an amended and restated Airline Services Agreement (&#147;Amended
Pinnacle ASA&#148;) between the Company and Pinnacle Airlines on January 11,
2007.&#160; See &#147;Note 21 &#151; Subsequent Events
(Unaudited)&#148; for further details on the Amended Pinnacle ASA.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">MAIR Holdings, Inc.:&#160; </font></i></b><font color="black" style="color:black;">On October 13, 2005, Mesaba, a wholly
owned subsidiary of MAIR, filed a voluntary petition for relief under Chapter
11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code in the District of Minnesota (Case No.
05-39258 (GFK)).&#160; In accordance with the
provisions of the Bankruptcy Code, Mesaba will continue to operate its business
as a debtor-in-possession.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">The Company continues to own 27.5% of the Common Stock of MAIR,
and accounts for this investment under the equity method of accounting.&#160; Our investment in MAIR Common Stock had a
market value of $40.6 million and a book value of $19.8 million as of December
31, 2006.&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:black;">Any losses incurred by Mesaba during its bankruptcy would
negatively impact the Company&#146;s net earnings, as well as the book value of the
Company&#146;s investment in MAIR.</font><font color="black" style="color:black;">&#160;
Other than noted above, the Company is currently unable to determine the
impact of Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy on its operations or financial condition with any
certainty.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest and Mesaba have entered into an airline services
agreement under which Northwest determines Mesaba&#146;s turboprop and CRJ aircraft
scheduling and fleet composition.&#160; This
agreement is structured as a capacity purchase arrangement whereby Northwest
pays Mesaba to operate the flights on Northwest&#146;s behalf and Northwest is
entitled to all revenues associated with those flights.&#160; Northwest paid $290 million, $393 million and
$421 million for the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004,
respectively, to Mesaba for airline services.&#160;
These payments are recorded on a gross basis as an operating
expense.&#160; The Company had a payable to
Mesaba of $53 million as of both December 31, 2006 and 2005.&#160; As of December 31, 2006, the Company has
leased 49 Saab 340 aircraft and 1 CRJ200 aircraft which are in turn subleased
to Mesaba.&#160; Refer to &#147;Note 21 &#151;
Subsequent Events (Unaudited)&#148; for details on the significant changes in the
Company&#146;s relationship with Mesaba that occurred after December 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Orbitz</font></i><font color="black" style="color:black;">:</font></b><font color="black" style="color:black;"> On December 16, 2003, Orbitz and its airline owners
(Northwest, Continental, Delta, United and American) sold approximately 12
million Orbitz shares through an initial public offering, which included 9.7%
of Northwest&#146;s total holdings. On September 29, 2004, Cendant Corporation,
Orbitz and the airline owners of Orbitz entered into agreements that provided
for the acquisition by Cendant of all shares of Orbitz for $27.50 per share in
cash. The sale passed regulatory and other approvals and the transaction closed
in November 2004. As a result of the sale, Northwest sold all 4,949,201 of its
remaining shares of class B common stock of Orbitz and the Company recognized a
gain of approximately $115 million in the fourth quarter of 2004.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">77</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='77',FILE='C:\Fc\74121428529_P66111CHE_1868503\5449-1-fq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 12:14 2007' -->

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 19
&#151; Geographic Regions</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is managed as one cohesive business unit, of which revenues
are derived primarily from the commercial transportation of passengers and
cargo.&#160; Operating revenues from flight
segments serving a foreign destination are classified into the Pacific or
Atlantic regions, as appropriate.&#160; The
following table shows the operating revenues for each region for the years
ended December 31:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s tangible assets consist primarily of flight equipment,
which are utilized across geographic markets and therefore have not been
allocated.</font></p>

31 are summarized below:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.7%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5.00</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">78</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='78',FILE='C:\fc\7415212960_H10056_1873074\5449-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 15:02 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Unaudited quarterly net income (loss) applicable to common stockholders
in the table above includes the following unusual items:</font></p>
