</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The sum of the quarterly earnings per share amounts may not equal the
annual amount reported since per share amounts are computed independently for
each quarter and for the full year are based on respective weighted-average
common shares outstanding and other dilutive potential common shares.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 21
&#151; Subsequent Events (Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Amended Pinnacle ASA.&#160;
</font></i>On January 11,
2007, the Bankruptcy Court approved the Amended Pinnacle ASA between the
Company and Pinnacle Airlines.&#160; The
Amended Pinnacle ASA provides that Pinnacle will continue to be a long-term
partner of Northwest through at least 2017.&#160;
In addition to reaching terms on an amended airline services agreement,
Northwest granted Pinnacle an allowed general unsecured claim of $377.5 million
for full and final satisfaction of any and all claims filed against the
Debtors, which resulted in an incremental charge to reorganization expense of
$306.7 million in January 2007.&#160; The
Amended Pinnacle ASA and related agreements provide Northwest with, among other
things, certainty of Pinnacle Airlines&#146; performance at rates consistent with
Northwest&#146;s cost savings targets and resolution of the Pinnacle Airlines
claims.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba Definitive Agreement.&#160; </font></i>On January 22, 2007, the Debtors entered into a Stock Purchase and
Reorganization Agreement with Mesaba under which the Debtors agreed to purchase
all of the equity interests in Mesaba following its reorganization under
Chapter 11 and granted Mesaba a general unsecured claim of $145 million for
full and final satisfaction of any and all claims filed against the
Debtors.&#160; The Debtors also agreed to
resolve all outstanding claims with Mesaba&#146;s parent, MAIR Holdings, Inc. (&#147;MAIR&#148;)
and to sell MAIR all of Northwest&#146;s stock in MAIR.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Additionally, Mesaba filed its plan of reorganization (the &#147;Mesaba Plan&#148;)
and its disclosure statement with respect to the Mesaba Plan (the &#147;Mesaba
Disclosure Statement&#148;) with the United States Bankruptcy Court for the District
of Minnesota on January 22, 2007 and January 24, 2007, respectively.&#160; On February 28, 2007, the Mesaba Disclosure
Statement was approved.&#160; A confirmation
hearing is scheduled for April 9, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Amended Plan and Disclosure Statement.&#160; </font></i>On January 12, 2007, NWA Corp. and thirteen of
its direct and indirect subsidiaries, including Northwest, filed with the
Bankruptcy Court the Debtors&#146; Joint and Consolidated Plan of Reorganization
Under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code.&#160;
On January 12, 2007, the
Bankruptcy Court granted the Company an extension until February 15, 2007 to
file the related Disclosure Statement with respect to Debtors&#146; Joint and
Consolidated Plan of Reorganization under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code (&#147;Disclosure
Statement&#148;).&nbsp; Subsequently, on February 15, 2007, the Company filed its
Disclosure Statement and First Amended Joint and Consolidated Plan of
Reorganization under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code (the &#147;Plan&#148; or &#147;Plan of
Reorganization&#148;).&#160; Copies of the Plan and
the Disclosure Statement were attached as Exhibits 99.2 and 99.3, respectively,
to our Current Report on Form 8-K dated February 16, 2007.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A hearing on the adequacy of information in the Disclosure Statement is
scheduled for March 26, 2007. After approval by the Bankruptcy Court, the
Company will distribute the Plan and Disclosure Statement to its creditors and
begin a period</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">79</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='79',FILE='C:\fc\7415212960_H10056_1873074\5449-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 15:02 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of solicitation of creditors for acceptance of
the Plan.&#160; The Disclosure Statement
contains detailed information about the Plan, the Bankruptcy Court&#146;s order
approving the Disclosure Statement, notice of the time for filing acceptance or
rejection of the Plan and timing of the hearing to consider confirmation of the
Plan, the rights offering, financial projections and financial estimates
regarding the Debtors&#146; reorganized business enterprise value.&#160; The information contained in the Disclosure
Statement is subject to change, whether as a result of amendments to the Plan,
actions of third parties or otherwise.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Amended DIP/Exit Facility.&#160; </font></i>On March 9, 2007, the Company amended its $1,225,000,000 Super Priority
Debtor in Possession and Exit Credit and Guarantee Agreement (&#147;DIP/Exit
Facility&#148;) to, among other things, reduce the margin applicable to loans by 50
basis points as well as eliminate minimum credit rating and collateral coverage
margin-increase thresholds.&#160; The
amendment also permits Northwest to grant liens on the collateral securing
obligations under the DIP/Exit Facility to support up to $150&nbsp;million of
Northwest&#146;s obligations under fuel, interest rate and/or currency exchange
hedging agreements with any lender that is a party to the DIP/Exit Facility.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">80</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='80',FILE='C:\fc\7415212960_H10056_1873074\5449-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 15:02 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9.&#160; CHANGES IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH
ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 31.5pt;text-indent:-31.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 9A.&#160; CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures &#151; </font></b>As of December 31, 2006, management performed
an evaluation under the supervision and with the participation of the Company&#146;s
President and Chief Executive Officer and Executive Vice President and Chief
Financial Officer of the effectiveness of the design and operation of the
Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures.&#160;
Based on this evaluation, the Company&#146;s President and Chief Executive
Officer and Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer concluded that
the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures are effective in alerting them
in a timely manner to material information required to be disclosed in the
Company&#146;s periodic reports filed with the SEC.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control Over Financial
Reporting &#151; </font></b>The
Company&#146;s management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate
internal control over the Company&#146;s financial reporting. The Company&#146;s internal
control system is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the
reliability of the Company&#146;s financial reporting and the preparation of the
Company&#146;s financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting
principles.&#160; Management performed an
evaluation under the supervision and with the participation of the President
and Chief Executive Officer and Executive Vice President and Chief Financial
Officer of the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting as of December 31, 2006. In making this assessment, management used
the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the
Treadway Commission in <i>Internal
Control-Integrated Framework</i>. Based on this evaluation and those
criteria, the Company&#146;s management concluded that the Company&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2006 was effective. The
Company&#146;s independent auditors have issued an attestation report on management&#146;s
assessment of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.&#160; This report appears on page 82.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes in Internal Control &#151; </font></b>There have been no significant changes in the
Company&#146;s internal controls or in other factors that could significantly affect
those controls subsequent to the date of their most recent evaluation.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">81</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='81',FILE='C:\fc\7415212960_H10056_1873074\5449-1-fs.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 15:02 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Report of Independent Registered
Public Accounting Firm on <br>
Internal Control Over Financial Reporting</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Stockholders
and Board of Directors</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Northwest Airlines Corporation (Debtor-in-Possession)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited
management&#146;s assessment, included in the accompanying Management&#146;s Report on
Internal Control Over Financial Reporting, that Northwest Airlines Corporation
(Debtor-in-Possession) maintained effective internal control over financial
reporting as of December 31, 2006, based on criteria established in <i>Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework</i>
issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission
(the COSO criteria). The Company&#146;s management is responsible for maintaining
effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of
the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting. Our
responsibility is to express an opinion on management&#146;s assessment and an
opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting based on our audit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We conducted our audit in
accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board
(United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over
financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included
obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting,
evaluating management&#146;s assessment, testing and evaluating the design and
operating effectiveness of internal control, and performing such other
procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our
audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A company&#146;s internal
control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally
accepted accounting principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the
maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly
reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)
provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to
permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally
accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the
company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and
directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding
prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition
of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because of its inherent
limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or
detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to
future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate
because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the
policies or procedures may deteriorate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, management&#146;s
assessment that Northwest Airlines Corporation (Debtor-in-Possession)
maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December
31, 2006, is fairly stated, in all material respects, based on the COSO
criteria. Also, in our opinion, Northwest Airlines Corporation
(Debtor-in-Possession) maintained, in all material respects, effective internal
control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2006, based on the COSO
criteria<b>.</b></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-justify:inter-ideograph;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We also have audited, in
accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board
(United States), the consolidated balance sheets of Northwest Airlines
Corporation (Debtor-in-Possession) as of December 31, 2006 and 2005, and the
related consolidated statements of operations, stockholders&#146; equity (deficit),
and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31,
2006. Our report dated March 13, 2007, expressed an unqualified opinion thereon
and included explanatory paragraphs related to (i) the Company&#146;s reorganization
under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code, (ii) the Company&#146;s
ability to continue as a going concern, (iii) the change in accounting for
defined benefit pension and other postretirement plans, and (iv) the change in
method of recognizing certain pension plan administrative expenses associated
with the Company&#146;s defined benefit pension plans.</font></p>

<h3 align="center" style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART IV</font></b></h3>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#NotesToConsolidatedFinancialState_204034" title="Click to goto ">Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements</a></font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15(a)(2)</font></b>&#160; <b>Financial
Statement Schedules.&#160; </b>The following is a list of the financial
schedules that are included in this Report.&#160;
Schedules not included have been omitted because they are not
required or because the information is included in the consolidated financial
statements or notes thereto.</p>

  II-Valuation of Qualifying Accounts and Reserves&#151;For the years ended December

following is an index of the exhibits to this Report.&#160; Nothing contained in this Report shall
constitute an assumption by NWA Corp. or Northwest (as applicable) of any of
these agreements.</p>

Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2004 and
incorporated herein by reference).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.34</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Northwest Airlines Corporation 1999 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.35</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Northwest Airlines Corporation 2004 Pilots&#146; Bridge Stock Option Plan
dated as of October 12, 2004, and Letter Agreement dated as of October 12, 2004
amending the 2004 Pilot&#146;s Bridge Stock Option Plan (filed as Exhibit 10.38 to
NWA Corp.&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2004 and
incorporated herein by reference).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.36</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>2001 Northwest Airlines Corporation Stock Incentive Plan, as amended.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.37</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Northwest
Airlines Corporation 1998 Pilots Stock Option Plan (filed as Exhibit 10.34 to
NWA Corp.&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2003 and
incorporated herein by reference).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.7pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.38</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amendment to

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.39</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Form of Non-Qualified Stock Option Agreement.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.40</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Form of Deferred Stock Award Agreement (filed as Exhibit 10.1 to NWA

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.41</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Form of Restricted Stock Award Agreement (filed as Exhibit 10.2 to NWA

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.42</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Form of Phantom Stock Unit Award Agreement for executive officers under

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.43</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Northwest Airlines Corporation E-Commerce Incentive Compensation Program

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.44</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Letter Agreement dated as of July 1, 2005 between Northwest Airlines

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*10.45</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Northwest Airlines, Inc. 2003 Long-Term Cash Incentive Plan, including

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12.1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Computation of Ratio of Earnings to Fixed Charges.</p>

of Section 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant
has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned,
thereunto duly authorized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each of the undersigned
directors and officers of Northwest Airlines Corporation whose signature
appears below hereby constitutes and appoints Douglas M. Steenland, Neal S.
Cohen and Anna M. Schaefer, and each of them individually, his or her true and
lawful attorneys with full power of substitution and resubstitution, for such
individual and in such individual&#146;s name, place and stead, in any and all
capacities, to act on, sign and file with the Securities and Exchange
Commission any and all amendments to this report together with all schedules
and exhibits thereto and to take any and all actions which may be necessary or
appropriate in connection therewith, and each such individual hereby approves,
ratifies and confirms all that such agents, proxies and attorneys-in-fact, any
of them or any of his or their substitute or substitutes may lawfully do or
cause to be done by virtue hereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the requirements
of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, this report has been signed below on
the 16th day of March 2007 by the following persons on behalf of the registrant
and in the capacities indicated.</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NORTHWEST AIRLINES CORPORATION</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(DEBTOR-IN-POSSESSION)</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SCHEDULE II &#151; VALUATION OF QUALIFYING ACCOUNTS AND RESERVES<a name="ScheduleIiValuationOfQualifyingAc_103706"></a></font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(In
millions)</font></b></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Uncollectible accounts written off, net of recoveries</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Interaccount transfers</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Dispositions and write-offs</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">S-1</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<body lang="EN-US" style=" text-justify-trim:punctuation">

<div>

<p align="right" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">EXHIBIT&nbsp;10.23</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">MANAGEMENT
COMPENSATION AGREEMENT</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">between</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">NORTHWEST
AIRLINES,&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">and</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">J.TIMOTHY
GRIFFIN</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">dated as of</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">January&nbsp;14,
2002</font></b></p>

</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\JMS\zaria\07-5449-1\task1868136\5449-1-kt-01.htm',USER='105281',CD='Mar 15 10:41 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">MANAGEMENT
COMPENSATION AGREEMENT</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">MANAGEMENT COMPENSATION AGREEMENT made as of the 14</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;day of
January, 2002 between Northwest Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., a Minnesota corporation
(the &#147;<i>Company</i>&#148;) and J. Timothy
Griffin (the &#147;<i>Executive</i>&#148;).</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">PREAMBLE</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The Company and Executive hereby desire to enter into a
Management Compensation Agreement dated as of January&nbsp;14, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">1. <i>Terms of Employment.</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">1.1</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Employment.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; The Company agrees to continue to employ
Executive, and Executive agrees to continue to serve the Company, on the terms
and conditions set forth herein.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">1.2</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Position and Duties.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; During the term of Executive&#146;s employment
hereunder, Executive shall continue to have his title, powers and duties as on
the Effective Date or such other powers and duties as may from time to time be
prescribed by the Company, <i>provided</i>
that such powers and duties are consistent with or represent a promotion from
Executive&#146;s powers and duties as of the Effective Date, unless otherwise
consented to in writing by Executive; <i>provided,
however</i>, that as long as Executive retains a substantial portion of
his then current oversight responsibility, the Company shall be permitted to
transfer a portion of Executive&#146;s oversight responsibility without the consent
of Executive. Executive shall devote substantially all his working time and
effort to the business and affairs of the Company and its affiliates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2. <i>Compensation.</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2.1</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Base Salary.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Executive&#146;s Base Salary shall be his base
salary in effect on the Effective Date, as increased thereafter by the Company.
Executive&#146;s Base Salary in effect from time to time may only be reduced in
connection with a base wage reduction for salaried employees of the Company, by
an amount not to exceed 20% of Base Salary in effect on the date of such wage
reduction. For purposes of calculating any other payments or benefits hereunder
(except as specified in Section&nbsp;2.4) any reductions in Base Salary shall
be disregarded. Executive&#146;s Base Salary shall be payable in accordance with the
Company&#146;s payroll policies.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2.2</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Bonus.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Executive shall be entitled to participate in
the Company&#146;s Key Employee Annual Cash Incentive Plan (the &#147;KEACIP&#148;) or any
successor annual bonus plan, the terms and conditions of which shall be
established by the Board from time to time.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2.3</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Expenses.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; During the term of Executive&#146;s employment
hereunder, Executive shall be entitled to receive prompt reimbursements for all
reasonable expenses incurred in performing services hereunder, <i>provided </i>that Executive properly accounts
therefor in accordance with Company policy.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">2.4</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Compensation and Benefit Programs of the Company.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Except as
set forth below, Executive shall continue while employed hereunder to
participate in the Company&#146;s employee compensation and benefit programs (or any
successor programs) at levels in effect on the Effective Date. Exceptions to
the preceding sentence are:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Amounts payable to Executive under the Company&#146;s
benefit programs may be reduced to reflect a benefit reduction for salaried
employees of the Company, in the same manner that salaried employees are
generally affected by such reduction.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Executive shall not participate in any severance
pay plan or annual bonus plan maintained by the Company except to the extent
necessary to receive any severance or bonus payments specifically provided for
hereunder.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">3. <i>Other Benefits.</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">3.1</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Airline Pass.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Executive shall be entitled to receive upon
termination of employment lifetime airline pass privileges for the personal use
of Executive and his or her spouse or registered domestic </font></p>


<br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\Fc\74131649504_P66484_1869189\5449-1-kt-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 13:16 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">partner and dependent children so long as spouses, registered domestic
partners and dependent children of employees generally are eligible for
nonrevenue travel pursuant to the Company&#146;s pass policies (hereinafter, &#147;Eligible
Individuals&#148;). Such airline pass privileges (the &#147;Airline Pass&#148;) shall entitle
Executive and Eligible Individuals to travel on regularly scheduled Northwest
domestic and international flights, subject to all charges and fees then
applicable to active management employees of the Company and their dependents
and pursuant to the Company&#146;s pass policies in effect from time to time, with
boarding priority of F-1 or the equivalent thereof for ten (10)&nbsp;years from
and after the date such pass is issued and 1-R or the equivalent thereof after
such ten year period. Executive shall be responsible for any personal income
tax liability arising from such pass travel. Notwithstanding the foregoing, all
benefits under this Section&nbsp;3 shall immediately and permanently cease in
the event Executive violates the Company&#146;s pass policies in connection with
such travel and/or in the event that Executive is or becomes, at any time
thereafter, an employee of any of the top five airlines in the United States
(other than the Company) ranked by revenue passenger miles.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">3.2</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Medical and Dental Benefits.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; While employed by the Company and thereafter
during the Executive&#146;s lifetime, Executive and his eligible dependents shall be
entitled to participate in the Company&#146;s medical and dental plans generally
applicable to all management employees of the Company under the same terms and
conditions as shall apply to such management employees; provided, however, that
if in the future Executive becomes employed by another employer, such coverage
shall become secondary to any coverage provided by such employer for the period
in which Executive is entitled to such coverage. In addition, while employed by
the Company hereunder, Executive shall be reimbursed by the Company for all
reasonable out of pocket medical and dental expenses incurred by Executive and
his eligible dependents and not otherwise paid or provided for under any
medical plan maintained for Executive&#146;s benefit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">4. <i>Termination of Employment.</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">4.1</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Upon Death.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Executive&#146;s employment hereunder shall
terminate upon his death.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">4.2</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">By the Company.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; The Company may terminate Executive&#146;s
employment hereunder at any time with or without Cause.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">4.3</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">By the Executive.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Executive may terminate his employment
hereunder at any time for any reason.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">4.4</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Notice of Termination, Payments.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Any termination of Executive&#146;s
employment hereunder (other than by death) shall be communicated by thirty
(30)&nbsp;days&#146; advance written Notice of Termination by the terminating party
to the other party to this Agreement; <i>provided</i>
that no advance Notice of Termination of Executive for Cause by the Company is
required.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">5. <i>Payments in the Event of
Termination of Employment.</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">5.1</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Payments in the Event of Termination by the Company for Cause or
Voluntary Termination by Executive.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; If Executive&#146;s employment hereunder is
terminated by the Company for Cause, as a result of death or Disability or by
Executive other than for Good Reason, the Company shall pay Executive
(a)&nbsp;his accrued and unpaid Base Salary through the Date of Termination and
(b)&nbsp;any vested or accrued and unpaid payments, rights or benefits
Executive may be otherwise entitled to receive pursuant to the terms of any
written retirement, pension or other employee benefit or compensation plan
maintained by the Company at the time or times provided therein.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">5.2</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Payments in the Event of Any Other Termination of Employment.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; If
Executive&#146;s employment hereunder is terminated by the Company other than for
Cause, or by Executive for Good Reason:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The Company shall pay Executive (i)&nbsp;his
accrued and unpaid Base Salary through the Date of Termination, (ii)&nbsp;any
bonus under the Key Employee Cash Incentive Bonus Program, or any successor
annual bonus plan, (the &#147;<i>Incentive Bonus</i>&#148;)
for any calendar year ended before the </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\Fc\74131649504_P66484_1869189\5449-1-kt-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 13:16 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Date of Termination, (iii)&nbsp;a
pro rata share (based on days employed during the applicable year) of the
Incentive Bonus Executive would otherwise have received with respect to the
year in which the Date of Termination occurs, payable at the time the Incentive
Bonus would otherwise be payable to Executive; <i>provided,
however</i>, that 100% of the Incentive Bonus shall be determined solely
with reference to the financial performance of the Company for the year (based
on the goals previously established with respect thereto) (rather than a
portion of the Incentive Bonus determined on the basis of individual
performance); <i>provided, further</i>,
in the event that Company&#146;s performance exceeds 100% of the financial
performance target for the year, that portion of the Incentive Bonus that would
have, but for this Section&nbsp;5.2(a), related to the achievement of the
individual performance target shall be 100% and (iv)&nbsp;any vested or accrued
and unpaid payments, rights or benefits Executive may be otherwise entitled to
receive pursuant to the terms of any written retirement, pension or other employee
benefit or compensation plan maintained by the Company at the time or times
provided therein.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In addition to the compensation and benefits
described in Section&nbsp;5.2(a):</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The Company shall pay Executive, no later than
thirty (30)&nbsp;days following Executive&#146;s termination of employment, a lump
sum amount equal to two (2)&nbsp;times the sum of (i)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s annual
Base Salary and (ii)&nbsp;the target Incentive Bonus for Executive with respect
to the year in which the Date of Termination occurs (or if no target has been
set for that year, the target Incentive Bonus for the immediately preceding
year).</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 108.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Until the earlier of the fourth anniversary of
Executive&#146;s Date of Termination or the date Executive is employed by a new
employer, Executive, his dependents, beneficiaries and estate shall be entitled
to all benefits under the Company&#146;s group life insurance as if Executive were
still employed by the Company hereunder during such period.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Executive shall not be required to mitigate the
amount of any payment provided for in this Section&nbsp;5.2 by seeking other
employment or otherwise, and no such payment shall be offset or reduced as a
result of Executive obtaining new employment.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Notwithstanding anything else to the contrary in
this Agreement, the Company&#146;s obligation regarding the payments and other
benefits provided for in Sections 5.2(a)(iii)&nbsp;and 5.2(b)(i)&nbsp;and
(ii)&nbsp;is expressly conditioned upon the execution, delivery and
non-revocation of a general release in the form attached hereto as Attachment
A.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">5.3</font><i><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Board/Committee Resignation.</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160; Executive&#146;s termination of employment for any
reason, shall constitute, as of the date of such termination and to the extent
applicable, a resignation as an officer of the Company and a resignation from
the Board (and any committees thereof) and the Board of Directors (and any
committees thereof) of any of the Company&#146;s affiliates and from the board of
directors or similar governing body of any corporation, limited liability
company or other entity in which the Company or any affiliate holds an equity
interest and with respect to which board or similar governing body Executive
serves as the Company&#146;s or such affiliate&#146;s designee or other representative.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">6. <i>Confidentiality; Non-Compete;
Non-Solicitation; Nondisparagement.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">While employed by the Company and thereafter, Executive
shall not disclose any Confidential Information either directly or indirectly,
to anyone (other than appropriate Company employees and advisors), or use such
information for his own account, or for the account of any other person or
entity, without the prior written consent of the Company or except as required
by law. This confidentiality covenant has no temporal or geographical
restriction. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;Confidential Information&#148; shall
mean all non-public information respecting the Company&#146;s business, including,
but not limited to, its services, pricing, scheduling, products, research and
development, processes, customer lists, marketing plans and strategies,
financing plans and the terms and provisions of this Agreement, but excluding
information that is, or becomes, available to the public (unless such </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\Fc\74131649504_P66484_1869189\5449-1-kt-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 13:16 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">availability occurs through an unauthorized act on the part of the
Executive). Upon termination of this Agreement, Executive shall promptly supply
to the Company all property and any other tangible product or document that has
been produced by, received by or otherwise submitted to Executive during or
prior to his term of employment, and shall not retain any copies thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Executive acknowledges that his services are of special,
unique and extraordinary value to the Company. Accordingly, Executive shall not
at any time prior to the first anniversary of the Date of Termination
(i)&nbsp;become an employee, consultant, officer, partner or director of any
air carrier which competes with the Company (or any of its affiliates) or
(ii)&nbsp;whether on Executive&#146;s own behalf or on behalf of or in conjunction
with any person, company, business entity or other organization whatsoever,
directly or indirectly solicit or encourage any employee of the Company or its
affiliates to leave the employment of the Company or its affiliates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">While employed by the Company and thereafter, Executive
agrees not to make any untruthful or disparaging statements, written or oral,
about the Company, its affiliates, their predecessors or successors or any of
their past and present officers, directors, stockholders, partners, members,
agents and employees or the Company&#146;s business practices, operations or
personnel policies and practices to any of the Company&#146;s customers, clients,
competitors, suppliers, investors, directors, consultants, employees, former
employees, or the press or other media in any country.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Executive agrees that any breach of the terms of this
Section&nbsp;6 would result in irreparable injury and damage for which there
would be no adequate remedy at law, and that, in the event of said breach or
any threat of breach, the Company shall be entitled to an immediate injunction
and restraining order to prevent such breach or threatened breach, without
having to prove damages, in addition to any other remedies to which the Company
may be entitled at law or in equity. Executive further agrees that the
provisions of the covenant not to compete are reasonable. Should a court
determine, however, that any provision of the covenant not to compete is
unreasonable, either in period of time, geographical area, or otherwise, the
parties hereto agree that the covenant should be interpreted and enforced to
the maximum extent which such court deems reasonable. The provisions of this
Section&nbsp;6 shall survive any termination of this Agreement and Executive&#146;s
term of employment. The existence of any claim or cause of action or otherwise,
shall not constitute a defense to the enforcement of the covenants and
agreements of this Section&nbsp;6.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">7. <i>Successors and Assigns.</i></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">This Agreement shall bind any successor to the Company, whether by
purchase, merger, consolidation or otherwise, in the same manner and to the
same extent that the Company would be obligated under this Agreement if no such
succession had taken place.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">This Agreement shall not be assignable by Executive. This Agreement and
all rights of Executive hereunder shall inure to the benefit of and be
enforceable by, Executive&#146;s personal or legal representatives, executors,
administrators, successors, heirs, distributes, devises and legatees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">8. <i>Term.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The term of this Agreement shall commence on the
Effective Date and end upon the Executive&#146;s termination of employment. The
rights and obligations of the Company and Executive shall survive the
termination of this Agreement to the fullest extent necessary to give effect to
the terms hereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">9. <i>Notices.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Notices and all other communications provided for in this
Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given when
delivered to and mailed by United States mail, addressed:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">if to Executive, to the address set forth on the
signature page hereto, and</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">if to the Company, c/o Northwest
Airlines,&nbsp;Inc., 2700 Lone Oak Parkway, Eagan, Minnesota 55121, Attention:
General Counsel,</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">or, in each case, to such other address as may have been furnished in
writing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">10. <i>Withholding.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">All payments required to be made by the Company hereunder
shall be subject to the withholding and/or deduction of such amounts as are
required to be withheld or deducted pursuant to any applicable law or
regulation. The Company shall have the right and is hereby authorized to
withhold or deduct from any compensation or other amount owing to Executive,
applicable withholding taxes and deductions and to take such action as may be
necessary in the opinion of the Company to satisfy all obligations for the
payment of such taxes or deductions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">11. <i>Certain Defined Terms.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">As used herein, the following terms have the following meanings:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Agreement</i>&#148;
shall mean this Management Compensation Agreement, as the same may be amended,
supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time in accordance herewith.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Base Salary</i>&#148;
shall mean the salary of the Executive in effect from time to time under
Section&nbsp;2.1.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Board</i>&#148;
shall mean the Board of Directors of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Cause</i>&#148;
shall mean with respect to termination by the Company of Executive&#146;s employment
hereunder (i)&nbsp;an act or acts of dishonesty by Executive resulting in, or
intended to result in, directly or indirectly, any personal enrichment of
Executive, (ii)&nbsp;an act or acts of dishonesty by Executive intended to
cause substantial injury to the Company, (iii)&nbsp;material breach (other than
as a result of a Disability) by Executive of Executive&#146;s obligations under this
Agreement which action was (a)&nbsp;undertaken without a reasonable belief that
the action was in the best interests of the Company and (b)&nbsp;not remedied
within a reasonable period of time after receipt of written notice from the
Company specifying the alleged breach, (iv)&nbsp;Executive&#146;s conviction of, or
plea of nolo contendere to, a crime constituting (a)&nbsp;a felony under the
laws of any country, the United States or any state thereof or (b)&nbsp;a
misdemeanor involving moral turpitude or (v)&nbsp;a material breach of
(a)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s Code of Business Conduct or (b)&nbsp;the provisions of
this Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Date of Termination</i>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to Executive, the date of termination of Executive&#146;s
employment hereunder after the notice period provided by Section&nbsp;4.4.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Disability</i>&#148;
shall mean Executive&#146;s physical or mental condition which prevents continued
performance of his duties hereunder, if Executive establishes by medical
evidence that such condition will be permanent and continuous during the remainder
of Executive&#146;s life or is likely to be of at least three (3)&nbsp;years
duration.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Effective Date</i>&#148;
shall mean January&nbsp;14, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Good Reason</i>&#148;
shall mean with respect to an Executive, any one or more of the following:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">a material reduction in Executive&#146;s Base Salary or
level of target bonus under the KEACIP or any successor bonus plan (except as
permitted hereunder);</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">except as otherwise provided in Section&nbsp;1.2,
any substantial and sustained diminution in Executive&#146;s authority or
responsibilities hereunder;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(c)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">the relocation of the Company&#146;s principal
executive offices to a location outside the Minneapolis-St. Paul Metropolitan
Area;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(d)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">a failure by the Company to comply with any
provision of this Agreement;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\Fc\74131649504_P66484_1869189\5449-1-kt-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 13:16 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">provided, however</font></i><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">, that the foregoing events shall constitute Good
Reason only if the Company fails to cure such event within thirty
(30)&nbsp;days after receipt from Executive of written notice of the event
which constitutes Good Reason; <i>provided,
further</i>, that &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall cease to exist for an event on the
60</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font><font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#160;day
following the later of its occurrence or Executive&#146;s knowledge thereof, unless
Executive has given the Company written notice thereof prior to such date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In order for Executive&#146;s termination of his employment to
be considered for Good Reason, such termination must occur within one
(1)&nbsp;year after the event giving rise to such Good Reason. Executive&#146;s
continued employment shall not constitute consent to, or a waiver of rights
with respect to, any circumstance constituting Good Reason hereunder.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&#147;<i>Notice of Termination</i>&#148;
shall mean a notice specifying the Date of Termination.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">12. <i>Executive Representation.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Executive hereby represents to the Company that the
execution and delivery of this Agreement by Executive and the Company and the
performance by Executive of Executive&#146;s duties hereunder shall not constitute a
breach of, or otherwise contravene, the terms of any employment agreement or
other agreement or policy to which Executive is a party or otherwise bound.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">13. <i>Amendment.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">No provision of this Agreement may be modified, waived or
discharged unless such waiver, modification or discharge is agreed to in
writing signed by Executive and an authorized officer of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">14. <i>Governing Law.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The validity, interpretation, construction and
performance of this Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of
Minnesota, without regard to principles of conflicts of laws.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">15. <i>Validity.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision or
provisions of this Agreement shall not affect the validity or enforceability of
any other provision of this Agreement which shall remain in full force and
effect.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">16. <i>Arbitration.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Except as otherwise provided in Section&nbsp;17 of this
Agreement, all disputes and controversies arising from or in conjunction with
Executive&#146;s employment with, or any termination from, the Company and all
disputes and controversies arising under or in connection with this Agreement
(except claims for vested benefits brought under ERISA) shall be settled by
mandatory arbitration conducted before one arbitrator having knowledge of
employment law in accordance with the rules for expedited resolution of
employment disputes of the American Arbitration Association then in effect. The
arbitration shall be held in the Minneapolis/St. Paul metropolitan area at a
location selected by the Company. The determination of the arbitrator shall be
made within thirty (30)&nbsp;days following the close of the hearing on any
dispute or controversy and shall be final and binding on the parties. The parties
hereby waive their right to a trial of any and all claims arising out of this
Agreement or breach of this Agreement. All costs and expenses incurred in
connection with any arbitration including, without limitation, arbitrator and
attorney&#146;s fees, shall be paid by the nonprevailing party in the arbitration
unless the arbitrator determines that such expenses must be otherwise allocated
under applicable law to maintain the validity of this Section&nbsp;16.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">17. <i>Specific Performance.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Notwithstanding Section&nbsp;16 of this Agreement, if
Executive breaches or threatens to commit a breach of Section&nbsp;6 of this
Agreement, the Company shall have the right to specific performance (i.e., </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\Fc\74131649504_P66484_1869189\5449-1-kt-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 13:16 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">the right and remedy to have the terms and conditions of Section&nbsp;6
specifically enforced by any court of competent jurisdiction), it being agreed
that any breach or threatened breach of Section&nbsp;6 would cause irreparable
injury and that money damages may not provide an adequate remedy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">18. <i>Cooperation.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Executive shall provide his reasonable cooperation in
connection with any investigation, action or proceeding (or any appeal from any
action or proceeding) which relates to events occurring during Executive&#146;s
employment hereunder. This provision shall survive any termination of this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">19. <i>Compensation Limitation.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Notwithstanding the foregoing, Executive and the Company
agree that (i)&nbsp;to the extent permitted by the Air Transportation Safety
and System Stabilization Act (the &#147;Act&#148;) any payments or benefits payable to
Executive under this Agreement (including, without limitation, payments under
Sections 2 and 5 hereof) or pursuant to any other compensation or benefit plan
of the Company or other arrangement between the Company and Executive that do
not comply with the Act shall be deferred until such payments or benefits may
be paid under the Act, and (ii)&nbsp;to the extent the Act does not permit the
deferral of any such payments or benefits, the maximum compensation and/or
severance Executive may receive from the Company under this Agreement or any
other compensation or benefit plan of the Company or other arrangement between
the Company and Executive will not exceed the amount allowed under the Act.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">20. <i>Entire Agreement.</i></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">This Agreement, together with the Release, any award
agreement between the Company and Executive entered into pursuant to the
Company&#146;s stock incentive plans, the Company&#146;s employee benefit plans in which
Executive will continue to participate as provided in this Agreement, and any
written arrangements in respect of travel on other airlines, contain the entire
understanding between the Company and Executive with respect to Executive&#146;s
employment with the Company and supersedes in all respects any prior or other
agreement or understanding between the Company or any affiliate of the Company
and Executive with respect to Executive&#146;s employment.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">7</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\Fc\74131649504_P66484_1869189\5449-1-kt-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 15 13:16 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Company and Executive have
executed this Agreement as of the day and year first above written.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
